Reviews.Title: “Luxe is Chic and has Superb Service”
Reviews.Author: SiskiyouTraveler
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Luxe on Sunset twice now and it has many excellent qualities. Foremost, the staff is very customer oriented and they go out of their way to please. The valet staff was plentiful and there was never a wait for my car to be taken or delivered. Room service was fast and efficient even after 10 pm. My room was always made up perfectly; fresh sheets on the beds without requiring a special request and evening turn down. Although the Luxe was some sort of motel in its former life, this is only evident in the hallways. The public spaces and guest rooms are very chic and decorated in soothing natural colors. Standard rooms are not huge, but the size is adequate. Rooms in the main building have balconies where you can sit outside and watch the birds in the foliage, a rarity in LA. The location is adjacent to the 405 freeway, but traffic noise is not a problem inside the rooms. The main negative was that construction was continuing on the 405 and there were detours on Sunset which were inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in LA!”
Reviews.Author: SXSMOM
Reviews.Content: Every time I travel to LA on one of my business trips, I stay at the Luxe on Sunset. I can always count on consistent service that's always stellar. Because I travel so much, I don't have much loyalty to a hotel chain other than it being 4 stars or better, as I've had inconsistent service when revisiting many hotels. The Luxe is always the same. Great staff, great rooms, and great food. I look forward to the complementary glass of wine they offer during their reception in the evening, and the turn down service is also a nice treat. I even love the location being right off the 405. I can jump right on and head to a meeting with no problem. I think the only downside that I have with the hotel is the parking. It's like $25/night, and there is only valet.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff in an amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Budsysmrs
Reviews.Content: We have recently been on a family trip around America with Luxe on Sunset, LA being our second port of call. The hotel is in a lovely location with spacious suites and rooms and the most friendly and helpful staff I have ever encountered with nothing being too much trouble. The food is really good and the overall cost of the hotel and service is extremely reasonable for the standard. I was really sad to leave here and would definately return and recommend to friends/family.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, good location, excellent support!”
Reviews.Author: FMFP
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel, the rooms are extremelly spacious and very stylish! We stayed there as two couples, got rooms just right opposite on the corridor - so attention to detail already at check in! The whole hotel has a very nice stlye and kind of atmosphere of busy, but calm - nice vibe! We only stayed two nights and had a lot to see in town, but I wish we could have enjoyed also the hotel facilities more. One important thing about the service I would like to highlight and give special thanks! We have left behind a few personal items in the hotel, which were found, held for us and sent to us with no delay. Irma Escobar, leading housekeeping services was extremelly helpful. Sending items to Europe can have customs duty issues - so was our case and Irma helped us right away to issue new documentation, etc. Very prompt responses and helpful approach - thank you very much for taking the time and effort and understanding how a couple of T-shirts or a pair of shoes can be so personal that you miss them! :-)) The hotel is also very convenient location, as a tourist you can reach many sights very easily! Once again great thanks to the hotel, but especially to Irma! .

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and responsive staff, nice property.”
Reviews.Author: Dayna P
Reviews.Content: My nephew's wedding was a wonderful experience. The staff at the Luxe was personable, friendly, and helpful. The room was comfortable. The food was good. The location off the 405 was so convenient for us. I would definitely book at the Luxe Sunset again.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: AdultTraveler12
Reviews.Content: The Luxe is accessible to several L.A. neighborhoods and attractions: notably the J. Paul Getty Museum (for which there is a shuttle service). The staff is courteous, friendly and eager to make your stay a positive one. Although there were initial glitches with my room (I had booked a suite online) I found upon arrival it was situated above the (noisy) front door and driveway. This was rectified the following day, however, and the rest of my stay was pleasant indeed. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: rl68
Reviews.Content: What a great experience. I was visiting Los Angeles from Friday-Monday and chose the "Lux" because of it's convenience to the 405. The staff is and hotel are very special!!!! Room sizes are amazing and the brunch on Sunday is out of this world. I can't find words to describe the bar staff......GRACIOUS!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exclusive Affordable luxe hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nick4734
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a Hollywood themed spring break vacation with our two teens. Every person on staff was courteous and friendly. Our joined rooms were spacious and comfortable. I found a feat deal for this hotel on hotels.com. Nearby westwood and ucla was a great location for our kids to hang out and have dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: mnfam019
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this really great hotel. I read reviews of past guests (they were all spot on) when booking new hotels. The staff was wonderul. The restaurant was nice (we tend to go out to see the city while vacationing so only dined one night but the food was very good). The location is amazing. You are just off the freeway but when in the room you would never know! It was quiet and tranquil. I will return when in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: will19
Reviews.Content: I am a very demanding guest at a hotel. I have stayed at the Luxe on Sunset weekly for the last four weeks. All but one week were for business, and I have yet to be let down by their customer service, friendliness, helpfulness and willingness to look after my every need. Whether it is coloring books for the kids, directions to a store. Even a waiter making sure my wife's food was kept warm or a constant look out for my needs while hosting meetings. From the wonderful sense of humor the desk clerks have to the politeness of the housekeeping staff whatever is in their Wheaties they are doing it right. The staff were so great with my five year old and made him feel so great that he made them a picture which they put up in the office. If you are looking in the high $200 to $300 range. You can't miss with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great bathroom, nice and modern decoration. If You happen To be in The upper building... A bit uncomfortable if it's”
Reviews.Author: PepeRivas2
Reviews.Content: I love The size Of The room I've got. It has every thing You could need if You come To LA To Work and need To spend time in The room. Also great natural light with nice views. And decoration is done with neutral colors, good taste and with all type Of beautiful plastic corals. You have To touch them To realize that are not natural! If You come in The summer time, ask To stay in The upper building, where The pool is. Up in The hill. But there is no bar or Restaurant there: you need to ask for a ride on one of their electric golf cars to go down for breakfast. It is the only rare experience you get. It is Also very quiet up there, at the pool building, which is great. I don't Know if in The summer, with The pool in action will Also be silent! The greatest experience: The room. And it's what You need in a Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb! Top to Bottom”
Reviews.Author: Grant M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at the Luxe Sunset for five days. From the moment we arrived we were completely impressed by the amenities and the incredible staff. We travel a lot for business and it's always great to see an establishment that reinforces the importance of a guests' experience through the professionalism of their staff. We had a great room up on the spa level with a semi private terrace with a long range view looking south east. Beautiful linens, wonderfully comfortable bed, comfy sitting area and a fantastic well appointed bathroom with double granite sinks, bathtub and a separate large glass shower enclosure. Plush robes and towels and an abundance of high quality toiletries were placed throughout the bathroom. Other hotels in the L.A. area charge 2 to 3 times more for this level of luxury and I truly believe this gives the Luxe an edge on an extremely competitive business in this town. I was in and out all day long and never waited more than 60 seconds for my car as their valet staff is always properly staffed with more than required number to be ready for rushes that can occur at any moment especially when there is daytime event at the hotel. The bar and restaurant are also very well appointed and as usual, staffed with top notch personnel and the food was sumptuous. We didn't get a chance to enjoy the spa but the pool area was very well located with lots foliage and south of France style cabanas for when you need to get out of the sun. Overall we would give the Luxe Sunset Boulevard Hotel a 12 out of 10 and we will definitely be back the next time we are in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: FelicityR
Reviews.Content: This is an ideal place if you are stopping over in LA, as we were, en route from New Zealand to the UK. You arrive disorientated because you've reached LA before you left NZ, to be met by the most wonderfully friendly and helpful staff. The hotel is on two levels tucked into a tree-covered hillside. Below are the restaurant, bar, conference facilities and rooms for people who want to be closest to these. We chose the higher level because of the pool and our room opened on to a little terrace from which you cross the grass and get to the pool which is beautifully planned, surrounded by loungers and palm trees. The warm water was bliss. The Getty Center is just up the road and a charming driver takes you there for free and you ring when you want to return. We ate very well in the hotel; our only gripe was that the bar had run out of snacks for both nights we were there. When we got home we found we'd left a package behind and the executive housekeeper couldn't have been more obliging in arranging to send it on to us. I know the US is famed for friendly service compared with the UK, but the staff here were really special - completely focused on making sure that guests had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Poolside cabanas were wonderful after a spa day!”
Reviews.Author: la_jazz_girl
Reviews.Content: We didn't stay overnight, but we did have a spa day here and that includes use of the facilities. The pool and pool area were very small, but (fortunately), it wasn't too crowded. The terry covered cushioned lounge chairs under the white cabanas were amazing! What a nice spot to have lunch after spa treatments! The only downsides are small: (1) the only restroom is inside the gym next to the spa; (2) spa waiting area is tiny; (3) you can call in your food order from the poolside phone, but once it's delivered, the waiter disappears and doesn't come back to check on you or for refills. Still, we had a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been happier!”
Reviews.Author: ashley c
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luxe Feb 14th-19th 2012 with 2 girlfriends for a wonderful girls trip. After months of researching hotels I couldn't be happier with our choice. I could rave for pages about how truly wonderful our stay was. The staff was polite, courteous and helpful. By the end of the stay we felt like the valet guys we're our friends. They were awesome. The front desk was more than accommodating every time we called down for anything. Our room was so spacious, clean and exactly as the pictures showed (2 full size beds) It was newly renovated and had all the space we needed. As 3 women you can imagine how much stuff we had! Hotel was peaceful and quiet. The location was centralized for seeing all areas of LA.(We went all over from Santa Barbara, Culver City, Burbank to Pasadena). While the construction was not great, it caused us no problems (other than normal LA traffic). Would stay here again in a heartbeat. Thanks Luxe!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely graceful”
Reviews.Author: foundationcitizen
Reviews.Content: I just stayed 3 nights (Feb. 2012). Everyone at every level was extremely friendly, which made a difference to my stay in LA. The food was also a surprise. The pumpkin ravioli and chopped salad were unbelievably good, like 5 star good. Another great thing was a FREE private car ride to and from anywhere within about 10 minutes. You just call them up, and they send someone out right away to pick you up, or to take you where ever you wish to go. That is service!! I agree with some of the other writers about the views, nothing to write home about. But, for me, it was quiet, and my room was great, clean, nice amenities. My one complaint was my tv, which was kind of small and no HD. I watched the oscars and was a bit frustrated with that. Everything else really was great.

Reviews.Title: “Detours, Highway Noise, Wrong Room”
Reviews.Author: columbuscirclenyc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, nice staff, good food...but construction around the hotel means a 5-mile detour after 10pm, they didn't have the king-sized bed available that we reserved and the sliding doors let in truck noise from the 405 all night long.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nicely kept room”
Reviews.Author: emileeetravels
Reviews.Content: This is a great location in the West LA area. Despite all the 405 construction going on near Sunset, we didn't hear any traffic or construction noise. Unfortunately, the walls are thin (like all hotels) so you will hear other guests but otherwise, this was a decent stay and not too badly priced considering the area. The room itself is very clean, modern, and well-furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Nice setting, unlucky with housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: joellehaddad
Reviews.Content: A regular visitor of LA, i was booked at the Luxe because the usual hotel i stay in was fully booked. The hotel was nice. Lots of greenery, nice pool, nice spa and nice spacious rooms. During my 18 day stay at the hotel, below is a list of the misadventures i had: - Hair in bathroom and bath tub at time of check in. It was still there even after i complained - Shortage of toilet paper, shower gel, soap etc.. - I was opting for the green option of not changing my bed sheets daily, but everytime i got into bed, i would find fallen hair of mine, cereal i had dropped etc.. they were just covering the bed and not even dusting it - i was staying in a room with a connecting door where i could hear what the couple was saying, watching, drinking (i could smell the coffee!!). After asking management to try and keep the room empty (i was suffering from a severe jetlag and desperately needed my sleep), i was surprised to find another couple being checked in there - Housekeeping talking loudly to each other at crazy early hours..i'm talking 5-6 am!! - Receiving an opened half eaten jar of mayo with my room service meal (meal was dropped from my bill) - My stuff were not being fixed or placed in their place..everything was left the way it was. After several complaints to front desk, the manager finally gave me a call. He addressed the matter graciously, offered to change my room (even had his staff move all my stuff) and profusely apologized. Also worth mentioning that during the room shift, my laundry bag went missing (later recovered) as well as my laptop case. Also beware that this hotel does not have its own parking and charges 25$/night. Because of the long duration of my stay, i managed to bring it down to 18$/night. Valet were super friendly and helpful. Eventhough i would love to go back to this hotel because of the hotel itself as well as its location (yes there are road works happening but it's no big deal - access to hotel is open from all sides), because of housekeeping, i am hoping i won't need to again.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal at high end in LA”
Reviews.Author: nypoppa
Reviews.Content: Second time we have stayed at the Luxe and have enjoyed both experiences - large, well equipped rooms with excellent bedding - particulralry good deals for the Jr. Exec Suite which we got at an excellent price from Expedia/Hotels.com weeks after we originally booked thru hotel web sites - which will generally match lower rates - two sections to the hotel and we have found the spa section with pool facing rooms to be the best - quieter, spacious with balconies - excellent staff - located a bit out of the busier areas of LA but if you have a car it is within short driving distance to Brentwood, Santa Monica, Westwood (UCLA), Bel Air and not much longer to Venice, Hollywood, W. LA - also right off of the 405 which when not in rush hour gets you to the valley, downtown and connects to the 10 towards the beach, Venice and LAX very easily - would recommend for any type of traveler but car is really important (probably true in most of LA) - lounge and restaurant could be improved

Reviews.Title: “Clean. Decent biz hotel”
Reviews.Author: cycleguyanon
Reviews.Content: I liked the luxe. We stay here from time to time when unable to stay with family. Restaurant on site is good and not ridiculously priced. The last room we stayed in had a lot of noise from the sliding door and the mngmnt sent someone up right away to fix it. I will say, the noise off the freeway is intense if you open the doors, so if you want super quiet, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “negatives may outweigh the positives”
Reviews.Author: Trup
Reviews.Content: The positive aspects of my recent stay at the Luxe were its location and pleasant/well-meaning staff. That said, this facility seems to show its age and feels a bit shopworn. More than that, there were some quirky aspects of my room; no smoking room (with $ penalty for violating well noted) but an ashtray and matches prominently situated next to my bed (!); the location of toilet paper dispenser requires an act of physical contortion to reach (!); when I returned to my room around 2:00 on the second day of my stay, the room had not been made up and there was no maid in evidence in my hallway -- I found one who came ten minutes later but managed to take my bathmat without replacing it; and so it went. The other odd aspect of my room was that there was no desk! There was a ledge with a stool on which I could sit and use my laptop but not exactly a comfortable "feature" or one that caters to people who need to use the computer with any frequency during one's stay. Still -- if you need to be close to people or offices in Westwood or Brentwood or want easy access to the 405 freeway, the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you upgrade your room!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovemaineusa
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights. First night we stayed in a regular room. It was awful. Tub would not drain, room was large but not updated. Bathroom was tiny and not nice... We switched to an upgraded suite and it was very nice. Four posted bed, sitting area, desk, and a very nice large bathroom with a separate stall shower and soaking tub. The tv was way too small for the distance from the wall to the bed. My only complaint is that the walls are so thin that our neighbors tv was heard the entire night. This is a good joice if you do not want to be right in the thick of things. It is in the suburbs and very close to Brentwood village and the Getty museum

Reviews.Title: “A Peaceful Oasis in LA's Brentwood Area”
Reviews.Author: constanttraveller100
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at the Luxe Sunset Boulevard was again first rate. A previous reviewer had cautioned guests to request a room away from the main building to avoid the potential noise of events there (weddings, parties, etc.). Good advice which we have taken twice and would reiterate to others. Many of the reviews comment on the high quality of the hotel, the beautiful setting (nestled in the hills with an almost oasis atmosphere) and the high quality of the service. We concur with all those positive comments. Only cautionary note to add some new information - there is massive public highway works being done in the area which occurs in the late evening. Before leaving the hotel at night request a plan for your re-entrance as the roads are all blocked with police guards who in our case, were unaware that the entrance to the hotel had been entirely blocked on Sunset Blvd. and in fact were unaware a hotel even existed in the restricted area. The hotel staff do not volunteer information when they see guests going out for the evening but this is a serious oversight on their part because the road closures are extensive and even getting into the area can be extremely problematic - let alone to the hotel itself. With this one exception, out stay was wonderful and we would highly recommend this hotel if you have a reason to be in the Brentwood/Santa Monica area. And do take advantage of the lovely little Brentwood village shops and restaurants just minutes away by car.

Reviews.Title: “One of our favourites”
Reviews.Author: bearnbudg
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Luxe twice now and really like it. Both room we've had have been very quiet, extremely comfortable bed and all mod cons. The location is perfect if you want to be partway between the coast and inland attractions, although a car is needed. You can easily drive down to Santa Monica or Malibu but just as easily go into LA, Beverley hills, downtown etc. Restaurant is great, particularly recommend the pancakes for breakfast !!!! Overall would definitely recommend the Luxe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation”
Reviews.Author: Marvin F
Reviews.Content: We were there for a wedding and the staff was always willing to go the extra steps to help. You do need transportation to go anywhere, as there is nothing in walking distance. Our room overlooked the courtyard, but the music at night and on Sunday brunch was not at all disturbing. The room was wonderfully appointed and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Sara B
Reviews.Content: A wonderful experience. The luxe Sunset was the host hotel for a wedding we attended. Our suite was beautiful, and the staff, from the front desk to housekeeping and room service were prompt and gracious. We've traveled the world and have experienced many five star properties. The Luxe can hold it's own among some of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel though a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: shannatic
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 1 night when in LA earlier this month. Was recommended it as a friend of mine lives 5 minutes away. It is a really beautiful hotel, spotlessly clean with lovely grounds. My room was spacious and the bed was comfortable, had a nice little porch and wasn't noisy at all. The staff were generally very friendly except for one older gentleman who acted condescending to me because I'm younger than most travellers who were staying at the property. Apart from this the only thing I can fault is that the hotel is a little far from the main attractions at West Hollywood and the beaches. But if you have a car or don't mind paying for a taxi, this is a great place to stay. Also loved the free welcome drink, it was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for LA visit”
Reviews.Author: lisa3
Reviews.Content: Third time staying here at the Luxe and I love it. Even though it is currently in the eye of the 405 construction storm it is still a quiet and lovely place to stay. Great rooms, well appointed and comfortable with excellent quality beds, pillows and bedding. Nice bathrooms, ample hot water, and clean pleasant decor. Great little bar and a great breakfast. Did not go to the jazz brunch but the band sounded good and I am sure food was good based on daily breakfasts. Service is excellent - everyone helpful and friendly - rooms spotlessly clean. Quick access to the 405 S allowed me to get to appointments easily and headed the other way one can enjoy Brentwood, Palisades, etc. If you want to stay on the West side, try this hotel. I prefer staying down on the main level rather than up in the spa level, but that is personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Massage and Body Wrap”
Reviews.Author: Sheri M
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip in LA and this hotel was recommended to me by my friend who lives in the area. She had been to the Hotel for some treatments in their spa. I was so exhausted from an all day meeting and was hoping to get a massage at the last minute. My friend had another gift certificate that she insisted that I use. The staff at the spa was very happy to assist me and get me in that evening. Allen greeted me with relaxing tea and I was swept away into my room for my two wonderful treatments. My technician Carol was one of the best massage therapists I have ever had. The overall experience was just what I needed. The hotel has a very nice resturant with an exceptional menu and staff. The hotel is very charming. I will definately be coming back to stay here on my next trip to LA.

Reviews.Title: “very goood”
Reviews.Author: Milan K
Reviews.Content: I like this hotel i was there many times and i was happy there ..nice pool nice fitness and the rooms are clean and modern...but this hotel is not good for people who dont have car becouse hotel is not in centrum...

Reviews.Title: “Nov. experience in the Luxe”
Reviews.Author: MLZ899
Reviews.Content: This is my third time to be at the Luxe hotel at Sunset Boulevard. The cost is actually not more than others in the UCLA and Getty Center area (even though some of those are only 3 star hotels), especially for the weekend which is usually high at L.A. I enjoyed the heated swimming pool, quite room, organic deco of the whole hotel, complimentary glass of wine, bottle water everyday, free wifi, coffee and tea in room, and the shuttle services to and from the Getty Center (we always had it free). When I had a guest visiting me, I called the front desk and asked for more tea bags (very unique tea, BTW), the hotel manager even sent in more bottles of water and a bag of dry fruit. It is close to Santa Monica and the beach. To other parts of the L.A. you may figure out taking the public transportation (check/ask at the Information Center in Hollywood or check the bus map before you come). Taking a taxi to anywhere in L.A. is very expensive. We used buses last time after we got detailed information at Information Center in Hollywood. To the airport, one has to take a taxi or the service provided by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: AJ_Traveller2010
Reviews.Content: I have never written a review for a hotel before, even though I have stayed in hundreds of hotels as I'm a travel consultant, the Luxe Sunset definitely deserves it! I recently stayed at the Luxe Sunset and it was perfect from start to finish. I arrived very late on my first night so I had organized a car to pick me up from the airport. The driver was very professional and lovely to talk to after a long flight. When I arrived at the hotel check in was a breeze, it was nice to have a friendly and speedy check in! I ordered room service on the first night and it was very good and nothing was too much to ask even at such a late hour. The hotel is in Bel Air and is nicely tucked away with lots of privacy. A car would be handy as its about a 20min cab ride to Hollywood however it was so nice to be away from the hustle and bustle. The freeway is very close to the hotel and I never heard it. My room was in the main building and was very nice. The decor was current and the bed was very comfy. I loved the bath products as well. Overall my stay was perfect but I was most impressed with all the staff I came in contact with who were all very friendly and very helpful! The service was 5 star standard (and i've stayed in a lot of 5 star hotels which wouldn't compare to the service here). I have been to LA many times and always find it hard to find a place I like, when I go back I will definitely be returning to the Luxe Sunset! Now I can end my search for the perfect LA hotel...i've found it!

Reviews.Title: “short stay”
Reviews.Author: ldb61
Reviews.Content: Arrived late Friday night and checked out Sunday morning, just a short visit for a family event. Stayed in double room on first floor, very quiet and extremely large room. I was in a corner room at end of the hall, so I don't know if that made the room larger. Staff were all consistently pleasant and very helpful, more than I expected. I never got to see much outside of the hotel and there did not appear to be anywhere to walk around nearby. Taxi to LAX was very easy, about $50. Hotel had a very convenient shuttle and the drivers were extremely friendly and interesting to speak with. Driver reminded us to phone when we needed a ride home, I had assumed they would just drop off, I was very surprised they could be phoned for a ride back. When we phoned for a return ride they remembered our location and promptly arrived. The shuttle service helped make our family event so much easier to attend. Definitely would return.. Location near 405 Freeway is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe on Sunset”
Reviews.Author: aviaracarol
Reviews.Content: This wonderful hotel really lives up to it's name. We always stay at this convenient location at 405 & Sunset Blvd. It has been our favorite for many years. It is newly renovated into a lovely, comfortable hotel with excellent service and a great dining room. We often have all of our L.A. family join us there for a gorgeous brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe-urious”
Reviews.Author: springforward
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Luxe Hotel for a business meeting. Great boutique hotel, well-appointed rooms and the service was incredible. First-class all the way around. I was very pleasantly surprised by the food as well. I had expected great food in the restaurants - however, we had a group of 30 that ate lunch and breakfast - the food was incredible! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: MSOGV
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful property with well maintained and spacious rooms, a very good restaurant, and excellent service. Most outstanding is the helpful and respectful staff. Every employee of this hotel whom I encountered during my stay was happy and courteous. Including those whom I met while wandering the halls at 4:30AM with Jet Lag!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised! Great service.”
Reviews.Author: Cave66man
Reviews.Content: I've recently stayed here for 3 nights for business. Great service and beautiful property. The staff was service oriented and was the best. While I was expecting my taxi I complained that I wish I had time to eat breakfast or at least a croissant...Rita at the front desk immediately asked someone to get some warm croissants and a coffee to go. I really was shocked by the level of service and will be back to stay here. Thanks to Rita at the front desk! Your customer service was outstanding! PS: Nice hotel, good location, great service,

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay, Fabulous Staff...”
Reviews.Author: Claudia_Pinto
Reviews.Content: My cousin booked a room for the night during my recent visit to LA... What a gorgeous hotel and the staff was on their game. The hotel has drivers available to take you anywhere you like and pick you up when you're ready to return to the hotel, and they were so eager to please. The same can be said about the valet staff, front desk and the bartender . I will defenitely return in my next visit to California.

Reviews.Title: “Little positive to say”
Reviews.Author: Eve G
Reviews.Content: After reading the other reviews, I can't help but wonder if we are talking about the same property. We thought the friend who recommended the property was playing a practical joke on us. We thought the location was terrible, not close to any of the usual tourist attractions or anything other than the highway, and not in an area conducive to walking. The hotel was bordered by the highway and construction, nothing else. The rooms are located on two different sites, connected by a very steep hill. The female who checked us in seemed friendly but failed to notify us that our rooms were up the steep hill and that we would have to lug our bags up and down stairs to get to our rooms. In fact, a male at the desk initially told us to lug our bags up the stair of the building were we checked in and, only when another worker we encountered informed us that we were in the wrong building were we informed that there was more than one building location. No one explained that there were shuttles between the buildings or gave us any useful information. When we finally found our rooms, we were pleasantly surprised with the size of the room with the two double beds. The room with the king was much smaller but still nice. The beds were comfortable but had minimum pillows. Robes and slippers were provided. The bathrooms were spacious but one of the rooms still had half full wine glass from the prior guest beside the jacuzzi tub so we were very concerned about the actual cleanliness of the room. We found that the only friendly and informative staff were the valet/shuttle workers and the two bartenders we met in the lobby bar. They were a joy to be around. The entire front desk staff, and particularly the males, were very snooty (the females much friendlier but failed to give complete information.) My husband requested assistance from a male at the front desk and was assured that help would be coming. No such thing. The "business office" was awful. The computers were slow and the printer did not initially work. It was only after requesting help several times that we were finally able to access and print our boarding passes. Luckily, for all other computer needs, there was good wi-fi in the rooms and throughout the buildings.

Reviews.Title: “Good friendly service”
Reviews.Author: SydneyVera
Reviews.Content: Our last two nights in the U.S. were spent at the Luxe Sunset Boulevard Hotel where the staff were uniformly friendly, polite and most accommodating. The room we were given, a deluxe king, was comfortable and spacious but had an outlook over the rooftop air conditioning units. When I requested a change, Megan at the front desk immediately found us an alternative in their spa building up the hill with a great view over the LA skyline. If you don't fancy the stroll uphill there is always a quick and easy shuttle alternative. Bear in mind that this hotel is very busy and caters to business groups so quiet relaxation can be a little difficult to find after a day at the Getty or wherever. The restaurant has some staff problems such as not fully understanding orders and forgetting essential ingredients but overall they try to make amends and the outdoor dining area is very pleasant. The heated swimming pool and surrounding garden is a real plus. Thanks to Megan at Reception, Martin in the driving seat and others who remembered our names and made us welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay...”
Reviews.Author: BakingBakers
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a very nice location. Close to the freeway and The Getty, minutes from UCLA, a short drive to Beverly Hills/Hollywood area. Rooms are updated and big. There is only mandatory valet parking (but you get unlimited in and out privilages.) Staff is very friendly, beds are nice, all around a good stay. There is a restaurant that we did not eat at, but there were a lot of people every time we walked by. I would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Familygdl
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked in we were welcomed and given a very early check in which was appreciated after a long haul flight. Service was consistent with all staff and duration of stay. The hotel has 2 sections - we were at the back, up a sloping driveway. I think I prefer this section away from the reception and lobby area where functions occur regularly (you can get the shuttle cart up the driveway). Nice comfortable room with view to pool/courtyard. No noise issue (except a/c which happens in most hotels). Lovely pool area. Courtesy car is available for guests to locations within 3 mile radius of hotel - very handy to get to the Getty Centre (well worth a visit) and restaurants (San Vicente has a few good ones). Free wifi, in room coffee and newspaper delivery. Hi to the guy who drove us to the airport in the town car - he was very proud of the hotel and we certainly enjoyed the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe hotel? Not sure...”
Reviews.Author: foxyfit4
Reviews.Content: Value: Average boutique hotel in West Hollywood/Westwood area. I stayed here for work and felt the accommodations were average. Not thrilled about the valet parking. Location: Hard to locate the place from the street. Right off the exit for 405. Centrally located, minutes from everywhere. Hotel: If you stay at the main lobby you have to take a cart to the pool/gym - FAIL! Rooms were spacious. A agree with other review "walls are paper thin". I enjoyed the hotel bar, had a little band there at night.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sneaky919
Reviews.Content: Nice quiet place. Staff is very friendly, like a bed and breakfast location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Service & Style - a Real Gem”
Reviews.Author: ppiaus
Reviews.Content: The Luxe is well located at the 'northern entrance' to LA on Sunset Blvd & San Diego Freeway. Bel-Air and Beverly Hills to the east & Brentwood, Santa Monica & Pacific Pallisades to the west. The Getty Centre sits on the hill above the property. The top notch renovation has produced a contemporary semi-resort hotel with spa. Service is friendly and professional - no request is a problem. We had an executive room - very large with desk, lounge area and a private terrace. It could be a little noisy (facing the freeway) - but there are plently of room options and this was not an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe Hotel "Spa Extravaganza"”
Reviews.Author: Beverly V
Reviews.Content: September 6, 2011 Hello Spa Lovers, We are so excited about our Labor Day Spa experience at The Luxe Hotel in Los Angeles, CA My friend and I were greeted and treated like Royalty by the Spa Manager, Allen (who made sure we were accommodated beyond our expectations). Our day started with a Swedish Body Massage at 10:45 AM done by Mylene and Nancy . . . â€œIncredibleâ€�. We both have a few medical challenges that Mylene and Nancy amazingly allowed for during the massage.ï�Š. We are convinced it was the finest and most relaxing massage, ever. We were then escorted to the swimming pool area (which has private cabanas as-well-as many other comfortable amenities) The next delightful surprise was having towels delivered to our chairs and umbrellas adjusted. This was followed by Terrific Servers letting us know what the BBQ Lunch menu was and if we desired anything to drink from the, â€œFull Barâ€�. WOW We chose The Kobe Beef burgers accompanied by a Pena Colada and diet soft drinks . . . YUMMY. Many guests we visited with, including ourselves, were already talking about our next visit to this Spa. After all, we need to try: Facials, Mani-Pedis, and of course the Energy Healing, etc... We spent the rest of our stay, relaxing, visiting, and enjoying every last minute in these â€œMost-Peaceful Surroundingsâ€�. Hope we will meet there on our next visit, Beverly & Janice

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mikeleahy
Reviews.Content: i loved this hotel. It was so quiet but still just off sunset boulevard. You have to travel everywhere and cant walk anywhere but once you accept this fact then its fine. Sunset is really busy and can be difficult to get onto but you will get used to this. The pool area is fab, constant attention from people offering towels / drinks etc. The bar is lovely and peaceful and the restuarant is also very nice with good food. Its expensive enough but it really feels like you are outside the city due to the location. Gym is very poor though

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was very beautiful in a very nice location”
Reviews.Author: petmav
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Brentwood, Bel Air Area and is next to the freeway 405. The location is excellent, as it is close to Santa Monica, West Hollywood, Hollywood and Beverly Hills. Although the Hotel is dated, the rooms are spacious, clean and decently decorated. Staff is very helpful and restaurant is cheap and has good food. Overall a very nice experience and would definetely recommend it. It would be appropriate to rent a car if you will be staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Wiseguy15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July 2011. It is conveniently located right off Highway 405 so we could hop onto the highway to get anywhere we needed to go.Luckily we were upgraded to an executive suite when we checked in so we had a large room for the 4 of us. We stayed in the building near the pool and tennis courts. The pool is magnificent with beautiful furniture and plently of towels. In teh morning we woudl drive over to San Vicente Boulevard which is a 5-10 minute drive away where there are plenty of cafes and restaurnats for breakfast. We really enjoyed our stay in LA.

Reviews.Title: “manager very helpful”
Reviews.Author: atennismom
Reviews.Content: had a problem with my room- general manager was very helpful in resolving my issue- level of service is consistent with hotel and would definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TFOPB
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luxe for 4 nights when we arrived in L.A. It is in a very convenient location, just off the main freeway, and within 15 minutes of Beverly Hills, Santa Monica and Hollywood. If you need a convenient location to see all the main attractions, with wonderful accomodation, excellent service, great food and well maintained facilities, then it is perfect. The rooms are spacious, clean, extremely comfortable beds, and nicely decorated. It feels like a boutique hotel, despite its size, all the staff are pleasant and cannot do enough to help you. They also have a free Shuttle Bus to take you anywhere within 3 miles of the Hotel, useful for evening meals and a drink! Our kids loved the pool area as well. Thoroughly recommend it as a good mid range stop off for your Trip. Universal, Warner - 30 minutes, Disney - 45 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful Rose Bowl stay at the Luxe”
Reviews.Author: bbb3
Reviews.Content: I am sort of late with this, but just thought about it today... We stayed 4 nights at the Luxe on Sunset over New Year's Eve weekend (in LA for the Rose Bowl). The location seemed to be very convenient - fairly close to Venice Beach & Santa Monica. We were in one of the suites near the spa. Every one on the staff that we met were very nice and helpful - the front desk, the valet, the bartenders, and the waitstaff. We had a nice New Year's Eve dinner at the hotel - everyone was happy with their meal. It was a very pleasant experience and we will stay there the next time we are in LA. We actually got a thank you note a couple of weeks after we left - never had that happen before.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All the Way”
Reviews.Author: Roderick088
Reviews.Content: First Class Hotel offering First Class Services. Clean, comfortable, friendly environment conducive to business and/or pleasure. Great place for a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “It was great and we plan to return.”
Reviews.Author: Trouble0121
Reviews.Content: We found that the Luxe Hotel was conveniently located, quiet and very comfortable. The atmosphere is cosy, despite being located just off the highway in a major city. The service, especially at the pool and restaurant, was very good. The rooms were clean and spacious, and the decor was inviting. The gym, albeit too small, was kept clean and in good condition, and the pool area was lovely. I was thrilled to be able to get a rate of under $200/night, although the rates seem to change daily. The management was very responsive to my post-trip review, which was very impressive. Overall, this was a great experience and we intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Eurotripers
Reviews.Content: Frequent travellers, Family Stay, Booked on line. Suggest advise if business or pleasure as may be more suited to business stay. Staff a little cold. Our first stay in LA as family from o/seas but not questioned by any staff throught stay on help with maps or tourist information. Front area more business with back area for Pool and R & R. Back area up a hill with no internal access to back area. Suggest also a car as close to LA sights and 405 freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Californiaforever
Reviews.Content: Everything was good. We loved those comfortable beds. Very nice and serviceminded staff. The food was great. The location was good. Close to Santa Monica and Venice beach and not far away from Hollywood. Peace and quiet even if you could hear the freeway, but that wasn't a big problem. It was a little bit expensive to park the car. We surely stay at this hotel again if we return to Los Angeles

Reviews.Title: “Great service and location; quirky facilities.”
Reviews.Author: santaclaraco
Reviews.Content: We came for a wedding. Great west LA location. The staff was terrific. Everyone was friendly and accomodating. The owners need to install elevators in the upper building; build a footpath between both buildings; insulate the walls between rooms; and check for little things like inoperative electric sockets and malfunctioning shower mechanics. Valet parking is a drag. The staff do the absolute best they can with the physical plant they are given. Restaurant and bar are LA prices, but good. Guests with mobility issues should discuss their needs before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: llabruyere
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Luxe property for business. It was conveniently located to the area I needed to be. I travel with a lot of gear, and the hotel staff was tremendously helpful with assisting me with all of my suitcases. I didn't need to lift a finger while on the property! Also, the restaurant is absolutely outstanding! I highly recommend enjoying lunch or dinner if you have the time. Fresh, quality produce - very healthy - with a beautiful presentation. I did not have the opportunity to enjoy the pool, sauna or spa - but will intend to with a return trip. The free wi-fi was also a BIG plus...

Reviews.Title: “Got What We Came For...”
Reviews.Author: swoodwor1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Luxe for a "getaway" 4th of July weekend. We were looking for peace and relaxation...and that's exactly what we got... except for the rowdy, hallway, late night, party people. I guess you find that anywhere these days. The staff at the Luxe could not have been more thoughtful and service oriented. The hotel is all the GOOD that has been written before - great location, spacious rooms, great pool, comfy beds, intimate dining and bar. So it's not the hotel or its staff that diminishes this place, it's the small percentage of its inconsiderate guests that make it a challenge.

Reviews.Title: “Super nice. Super accomodating.”
Reviews.Author: ramseycooper
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel because it was close to UCLA. But it is so much more. The accommodations are really nice, clean, pool is beautiful and very well kept, restaurant is good location is convenient, and shuttle service within a certain radius is great. (The Getty is up the hill.). But what I really found interesting and very refreshing is that I never felt a hand out waiting for a tip. The staff was professional from the front desk all the way to the parking guys. Helpful, courteous, and with all of the Rolls there, there was no class distinction play either. If I have any suggestions, I would say get a good espresso/latte machine and hire a good barista. You can't just walk out and get a coffee so it would be nice to get a real latte etc, not the ones that they are making now. And, if you are hankering to be someplace where you can walk out the door and be in the thick of it, this may not be the place for you. But it is close enough th be in the thick of it, and removed when you want it. Kudos to a very nice hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Second Stay Just As Good”
Reviews.Author: Carolind
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luxe in August 2007 and didn't look at staying anywhere else on our return to LA. Personally I prefer a hotel that's safe, secure and in a good area rather than staying in a hotel so I can brag that I stayed in it. For example you only stay at the Chateau Marmont to say you have been there. Luxe is in probably the best suburb in LA, Brentwood, which is a beautiful neighbourhood and safe to walk in - the main reason we stay there. The hotel itself is neat, clean and pretty modern. We love the pool area and since we stayed last time they now have a bar at the pool and provide cold water and apples along with cabana's. The staff are all so friendly and helpful. It's very quiet, we never heard our neighbours in the next rooms if there were any. There seriously isn't much to complain about this hotel and I think if you can find something, you will be pretty hard to please anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here, if you like firm mattresses!”
Reviews.Author: joanf59
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel would otherwise be a great location at a reasonable price, if the beds weren't like sleeping in a motel bed--feels like a hammock. The rooms are spacious, but the furniture and the carpets need a major re-do. Its circa 1968, with outdated furniture. Other than that, its a great location, easy freeway access. Be sure to ask for the first floor and away from the bar/event side of the hotel...otherwise you may hear loud noises and music all night long. As a matter of fact, you may catch a few tid-bits from the adjoining room, as voices and other such noises can be heard from the bed and bathroom area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near UCLA and Getty Museum”
Reviews.Author: GoUCLAbruins
Reviews.Content: We booked several rooms at this hotel for our daughter's graduation from UCLA. It is a fantastic location nestled in Brentwood. My mother's room was over the bar and we asked to change the location which they did. The only problem is that there is tremendous traffic due to construction/extention at the 405 and Sunset overpass especially in the late afternoon. On July 16-17 they are actually shutting down the 405 around the Sunset exit so I would stay away from LA. The rooms are very spacious and can easily fit a role away. The bathrooms could use some updating! The water pressure was great. There are two buildings at the hotel- we stayed in the main building. The other building is a walk up the hill or they can drop you off in a van. In the upper building is the spa, gym and hearby tennis courts. The gym is less than desired and has minimal equipment.Our night included a lovely continental breakfast- 3 small pastries,fresh fruit, fresh juice and coffee/tea. Everyone at the hotel was very accomodating. Parking is $25/night extra. The staff gave is excellent recommendations for restaurants. The only issue was that they thought we were checking out a day early so our keys didn't work. They quickly replaced them and all was well. We appreciated receiving the LA Times everyday (vs USA Today). They may not have enough LA Times so not all rooms got them but you can ask for it in advance to make sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelingwfamily
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicest hotels I've visited. The rooms were extremely spacious, with a desk area and living room set that were all in the same room, but so far apart it seemed to be a small apartment! The decor was amazing, gorgeous beiges and well kept furniture. The bathroom was as big as a room, with a separate jacuzzi and shower (this is the standard room!) and decorated in a beautiful manner also. The hotel surroundings were really nice, beautiful sun terrace for beakfast and gardens. I did not have time to visit the pool. The staff waas really helpful too! Overall I would return to this hotel any time, I had an amazing stay!

Reviews.Title: “The whole package”
Reviews.Author: kekwiatkowski
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel and I promise I am not affiliated with them in any way. Just an overwhelmingly positive experience has led me to writing this review. My fiancÃ© stayed here in October 2010 and after hearing about his experience we had to stay together. I had the pleasure of staying here for 11 nights. We stayed in a king suite in the main building. The staff at this hotel actually love their job and enjoy making people (no matter who you are) feel important & valued. Valet, Bellmen, Front desk, Concierge, Restaurant, After hours managers and security all go above and beyond everyday. I've never stayed at a hotel that the staff are so consistently good. The king suite is spacious & clean with a comfortable bed, good wifi and nice touches like a welcome drink & fruit; turn down with chocolate and daily newspapers. The noise from the 405 is well screened by beautifully landscaped gardens. The area is safe. The only negative about the location is the off ramps/bridge area can be congested at peak hours but leaving 5-10 minutes earlier resolves that. After a 6 week holiday in the US, this was a perfect way to end it. U can't wait to stay here again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike424u
Reviews.Content: Eventualy pulled in to Hotel Luxe and we were knackerd to say the least, so we just got out the super shuttle transfer and picked up the bags and head to check in, then looking around something did not feel right, Yeah you guessed it wrong hotel luxe, they had taken us to the Sunset Blvd. As soon as we asked for help at check in they fell over backwards to assist us, and we can not fault them or there attitude. They tried to call super shuttle back for us, but were kept on hold for over 30min, and at this point my blood was boiling and I was ready to give some one a mouth full of abuse. lucky for them ( super shuttle that is) would not help at all. Hotel Luxe ordered us a taxi and even paid for it, $35, I think they were glad to get rid of us, and almost paid us to leave hahaha. But saying that they were really helpfull and we cant thank them enough. Evntualy arrived at the correct Hotle Luxe, so top tip make sure your at the correct Hotel Luxe if your from over seas like us, and dont have clue where you are in this vast city. As for super shuttle, avoid them like the plauge, they are the worst airport tranfer company we have ever dealt with. While staying at Luxe Rodeo drive we witnessed other travelers having problems with pick up and rop of with super shuttle.blue vans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Friendly and Relaxed hotel”
Reviews.Author: itravellot
Reviews.Content: First off, the location of the hotel is unbeatable! Minutes away from Beverly hills, Santa Monica Pier, Pacific Palisades, you name it!! It is right in the heart of all the action. As we drove up, we could not help but notice that the hotel was just off a major highway but once you go inside its a world of its own tucked in a beautiful setting of green. The front desk staff was friendly and got us all set up in a matter of minutes. The room was large and roomy (It was a pleasant surprise considering the location the hotel was in). Housekeeping was great with turn-down service in the evenings along with fine chocolate!! Business center is a nice facility. They have nice apple mac and free printing for your boarding passes etc. The management try its best to connect with the guests. We had Rejinald (The general manager) come and talk to us personally which was really nice. If you have a problem do not hesitate to talk to him. He will make sure your stay is pleasant. He simply is the best! Some of the things the hotel could work on is upgrading its rooms with newer television sets and adding some color to the rooms. The front desk could include a concierge that provides guests with some insider info about the area. For the most part , they did not have a clue about the attractions around. Also, the Valet parking each time you get in and our could be a little annoying. There are too many valets hanging around all day. But all in all, If you need a comfortable, friendly hotel in the heart of all the action at a reasonable price, this hotel is hard to beat! Go for it. You will not be disappointed! Call them directly to book your room.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service Makes a Big Difference”
Reviews.Author: sonjaskage
Reviews.Content: After my recent stay, I asked myself what makes the difference between exceptional or outstanding service, which Iâ€™ve experienced elsewhere, and the extra something that was evident at this hotel. The thing Iâ€™ve been able to identify is that their employees are obviously well trained to deliver great service but in addition to this they also like working there and appear to enjoy the people they interact with. They were joyful and happy to do their jobs and we very much noticed and appreciated this distinction. People who genuinely like their jobs and their boss and their co-workers plus the people they are of service to is actually something that canâ€™t be trained and is not easily defined but we all definitely know if when we see it. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for the price!”
Reviews.Author: sshields97
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at this property in the last 3 months and I can easliy say that it will not be the last. The service and the grounds are impeccable! The beds are quite comfortable, although just as the previous reviewer, I too confirmed a King bed and was given two doubles instead. I did not question the room switch since it was just me staying for the 3 nights. The restaurant on the property is very good, a little pricey but very good. The first night I stayed I had the Braised Short Rib Risotto...ridiculously good! Overall this was an excellent trip and I would recommend to business travelers who like spacious rooms and great service!

Reviews.Title: “Sad I brought my gf here for valentines day...not happy”
Reviews.Author: maxornelas
Reviews.Content: I am still actually staying here. I agree with everyone else that said its very noisy at this hotel. Its halfway through february and I read in another review that they planned on fixing it sometime in february. I really hope they do. I brought my girlfriend here for valentines day and really wish I hadn't wasted my money bringing her here. We arrived today feb 13 at around 3pm. expecting a welcome package since that was part or what I payed for as a suite package. It is now exactly 10:20pm and I am still waiting for it. I have called the front desk 3 times and they have reapetedly said it was on its way. Im still waiting. Another big setback was that the television was all blurry for about two hours until it "warmed up" and then it finally cleared up. I was going to update to the vista suite and the front desk lady first told me it would cost me $80 then a couple minutes later told me it wuld cost $100(come tolater find out they really only cost$ 40 to upgrade). Very unhappy w my experience I have stayed at hotels that are cheaper than this place around the area and have had way better experiences elsewhere. I am only 23 years old so im not super picky or hard to please. I just really expected alot more. I work really hard for my money and really feel dispointed about the way my experience was at this hotel. They could have at least compensated me a little bit for all the trouble I had but the people at the front desk really didn't seem to care. If manegement reads this and feels a need to hopefully somehow make things right I can be reached at [--]. if not oh well I guess that's how you guys like doing business and it sucks for a hardworking guy like me.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe NOT very luxe”
Reviews.Author: lottieeb
Reviews.Content: I took advantage of a sale on Jetsetter (by Gilt group) at the Luxe Sunset Blvd for a trip to LA. I go a few times a year to visit friends/family and have stayed at many hotels in a range of prices. I was excited for the Luxe, but I'm highly disappointed. First, we requested a king bed, the request wasn't honored even though it was on my confirmation form.Tthey said they never received the bed request and apparently the hotel was completely booked so they were unable to give us a king room or upgrade us (or so they say). The two double beds are comfortable, but not big enough for two people comfortably... Next, room wasn't totally clean and some towels has weird stains. Worst of all he hotel was VERY loud. We got here yesterday and at midnight when we were trying to get to sleep the TV was blaring in the next room and people were talking all over the place. I understand there are other guests here, but the walls are paper thin and we had a horrible sleep, the noise started again at 6am. Not very fun after a flight from the East coast and the time change. We're in our 20's, so we have a high tolerance for noise, but this was ridiculous. The one saving grace is some of the staff, they promtly brought us new towels, some softer pillows and earplugs (though those didn't help) as soon as we requested them. I'm really disappointed with my experience and will never get anything on Jetsetter again either! We still have one more night here and I want out.

Reviews.Title: “WONDEFUL, FRIENDLY, PERSONAL PLACE TO STAY IN L.A!!!”
Reviews.Author: dakazibear
Reviews.Content: Myself and my good friend came to L.A for a shopping trip in Dec 2010 and This Hotel was not my first choice when i was looking for a place to stay, but i am SO glad we stayed there! Nothing was too much trouble and all staff were amazing from the valet and house-keeping to the front desk, they were all friendly and very helpful. The room are a good size- we had a room with two comfy double beds and the room never felt small-even when we filled it with lots of great L.A shopping! The Hotel is beautifly styled and the bar and resturant is lovely. The Hotel is in two halves and We stayed up near the pool-which is so nice. The Location is great and quite central, but you do need a car, but again everyone who comes to L.A knows that. There is a nice village(brentwood) down the road and the Hotel offer a free shuttle to guests who wish to go down there for dinner etc, the Getty is also very close. If I could be picky, the gym is not very good, but at the end of the day, we weren't in L.A to exercise, we were there to SHOP! And sometime we could hear the people in the room up above us. And wish the bathroom was bigger,but what girl doesn't! This hidden treasure is a must for the traveller who wants a quiet nights sleep and personal service. I must give a big thanks to the conciegre Debbie, who made our trip extra special.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Angeleno a better option”
Reviews.Author: ptesche
Reviews.Content: I should begin by acknowledging that some of our complaints about our stay (see below) resulted in an adjustment to our daily rate by the Operations Manager at the hotel, Sherwin Banda. The General Manager, Reginald Archambault, seen defending the hotel in numerous posts on TripAdvisor, was not at the property when I inquired. I also can echo comments made by other guests that the location is extremely convenient if your plans include visits to the Getty Center or Bel Air, Beverly Hills or Hollywood. The valet service, while expensive and your only parking option, was very efficient and courteous. The housekeeping was generally very good although they frequently left all of the lights on in the room (not our problem but not very energy conscious). In general, the staff at the front desk was well-intentioned. Having said all of the foregoing, I can think of no circumstance where I would recommend to anyone that they stay in this hotel. First off, the structure is poorly suited physically to be a luxury hotel. We were told by hotel staff that the property started life as student housing for UCLA in the 1950s. As noted by others, the rooms are contained in two unconnected, two-storey buildings separated by a steep hill others have estimated as being 200 meters. The front desk, underground parking, â€œbusiness centerâ€�, restaurant and some guest rooms are located in the lower building while the balance of the guest rooms, the â€œgymâ€�, pool and spa are located at the upper building. As other reviewers have noted, the walls apparently are paper thin as you can hear your neighbors talking, coughing and using their toilets. Upon checking in, we elected to avail ourselves of an upgrade to an Executive Suite for an additional $40 per night. The room was larger as was the bathroom with a double sink; however, the bed was immediately in front of the door allowing any passerby a view of the occupied bed if the door was opened which would make most women, in particular, quite uncomfortable. There was a seating area located in an alcove in the room but there was a pillar in the middle of it suggesting that perhaps the area, at one time, had been part of another room or an outside patio that had been enclosed. The bathroom lacked sufficient counter space and had only a single towel bar. There was a single rather than a double connecting door with the next room. For room security, rather than the common swinging latch seen in most hotels these days, there was an old fashioned chain lock but only a single screw held the mounting in place on the door frame. Also, in the hallway leading to our room, a service door to the outside was repeatedly left ajar further adding to oneâ€™s sense of insecurity. One morning a roach appeared on the bed (fortunately, no bed bugs). After killing it, I showed it to management whose defense was that it wasnâ€™t a roach but wasnâ€™t really sure what kind of bug it was. We were also told that when it rains, insects find their way into the rooms. My view is that this would not be the case if (a) the sliding glass doors in the rooms were properly fitted and (b) the hotel had regular service from an exterminator. There were repeated problems with hot water in the shower. On two days, only one of us could take a shower as the hot water ran out. On another occasion, the water kept getting hotter and hotter suggesting that there was no scald protection in the plumbing fixture. In addition, at all times, there was weak water pressure. On two of the four days of our stay, there was no paper delivered to the room. They â€œran outâ€�. The entrance to the hotel restaurant is a sliding glass door leading from an outside courtyard. The restaurant is effectively â€œland lockedâ€� with no interior entrance for guests (inconvenient to uncomfortable if it is raining or cold outside). The floors are uneven in both the rooms and in the restaurant. The sliding glass doors in both leaked when it rained. One restaurant patron complained his feet were getting wet because he was seated near the windows. Workers from the hotel put up a makeshift barrier outside of our room by placing a sheet of plastic film along the sliding glass doors and pinned it in place by moving the plastic patio chairs close to the doors. The carpeting in our room appeared to have been recently â€œrestoredâ€� (but still stained) following likely flooding from torrential rains in Southern California the previous week. Further evidence of poor attention to detail was the fact that light fixtures, a/c vents, mirrors, etc. were rarely level or square. The workout room or â€œgymâ€� was located in a converted small guest room with limited equipment. The walk up the hill on several cool mornings was quite â€œbriskâ€�. The â€œbusiness centerâ€� was the size of a modest, windowless closet where one of the two computers available was out of service during our entire four day stay. Finally, for breakfast one morning in the hotel restaurant, I found that the milk on my cereal had soured and curdled. Because the regular coffee was awful, I ordered a latte but the milk in it had also gone sour. Both items were readily replaced by the attentive wait staff. Based on reviews on TripAdvisor and comments from some local residents, it would appear that the nearby Hotel Angeleno (a former Holiday Inn) would be a much better alternative to the (mis-named) Luxe on Sunset.

Reviews.Title: “High Points & Low Points”
Reviews.Author: tripstyler
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a weekend at the Luxe Hotel Sunset Blvd. I've stayed in LA many, many times and love the location of this property in relation to all the neighborhoods, restaurant centers and shopping areas I like to frequent while I'm there. All in all, I would stay there again, but my experience was a 6.5 out of 10. This hotel has a lot of potential and does many things well, but a few inconsistencies--like some front desk agents asking how departing guests stays were and some not even bothering to ask the question---stuck out to me during my stay. Details listed below. High Points: - Deborah, the hotel's Concierge is wonderfully helpful and all her suggestions and tips were bang-on - Most front desk staff were very helpful - All valet staff were friendly and fast - Restaurant staff were lovely - Bed and bed sheets were very comfortable - Towels are soft and plush - Outdoor areas are beautiful Low Points: - Getting a call at 6.30am telling us our car was ready (but we never scheduled or called for it) - Free Wifi was shotty at best, it worked one second and not the next for the entire 4 days we stayed - Room was great, but a little rough around the edges. The bed and bathroom vanity had significant marks and chips all over them. I mention this because this was not the case in any of the multiple hotels I've stayed in this year. - Finally, you'd walk down the hallway and you'd see empty room doors open, maintenance doors open, etc.. Good to Know: - Design - Hotel has a modern, beachy-chic decor that's carried throughout the property - Room - I stayed in a room with a king bed and nice sitting area, the room was very spacious - Hotel room doors are far from soundproof. You can hear every hallway conversation through the closed door - Parking is only valet and $25/night - Hotel is just off the 405 hwy under the Getty {very central location} - Pool area is nice. I read a review from someone else that mentioned only 3 guest could be in the pool at one time which is preposterous All in all, I'd stay there again, but in some ways, this 4-star felt like a 3-star. Maybe I hit the hotel in an off time?

Reviews.Title: “Could have been much much much better”
Reviews.Author: chaouhi
Reviews.Content: I am actually still checked in, so i will make it brief, i looked at 6 rooms, all of which were extremely stuffy. I think its the detergents they use on the carpeting, if you're allergic like me, beware! Now location is great, and the staff are extremely helpful and patient. Yet the stench of the rooms, even the fact that my room overlooks the XXXXX is not what bothers me most. The windows are disgustingly dirty! Walls are paper thin, and connecting doors are made of steel, working on this desk, i could literately hear's my neighbour's conversations! Why should i wake up to a dirty view of LA!! Finally, the beds are catastrophic!!! Who uses springs on mattresses any more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: Iwillgo2011
Reviews.Content: The shower head didn't work. The air conditioning didn't work. The Front Desk was indifferent. Our room was updated and spacious. Although, others in our group had smaller dingy rooms. The valet staff were very courteous. For the money spent I would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Retreat”
Reviews.Author: RockportTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this LUXE for three nights mid week for business travel the last week of September . We usually stay in Santa Monica area but deceided to try a change, this LUXE was close to Santa Monica and close to just about everything else we needed. We loved the walk up the small hill to the workout room and found it to be the perfect start for our day . Didn't have time for the pool but we wished we had. We also did not have time to try the restaurant but we did settle in for some cocktails one evening. The hotel staff was always very attentive and the decor was beautiful. The lushness of the landscaping was tranquil to us and we enjoyed driving in each night after working all day to this pretty place. Very relaxing and had good night's sleep. I travel with a small electric air diffuser anyway, so if there is any noice around I rarely hear it wherever I go. This place feels like a healthy place. The night we checked into the hotel , there were about 200 people in line to get their cars from valet, ended up it was a local fundraiser in the Brentwood area. A lovely group of people to see , all dressed so nicely, it was exciting for us to see this as we had been traveling airports all day. . We suppose the area residents choose this hotel for their own out of town guests. I think Valet parking was 30 dollars a day . I just kept a bunch of $5. bills handy for tips when valet brought our rental car around and to leave on the bed for housekeeping each morning. Just figure it in your hotel price and don't let it ruin your day that the parking isn't including in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: JTGLS
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel early July 2010 with our two children (8 year old and 1 year old). We arrived extremely exhausted a couple of hours before our check in time after flying 14 hours and another 5 hours in airport customs/transfers to hotel etc. Reception staff could not have assisted us enough in arranging a room for us as soon as possible - room was ready within 45 minutes. Room we booked was the superior double room which was clean and big. Everything we asked for the reception or housekeeping was on to it, even providing a microwave for the 4 nights we stayed at no extra charge. As it was our first time to the US the staff were extremely helpful in arranging a hire car and provided us with easy to understand directions. Used the pool only once as it the weather was cold - but pool was nice. Ate breakfast a couple of times in the restaurant and again food was great and staff was amazing. It was a great start to our holiday and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay with super service!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetlady
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 1 week at the end of July and beginning of August 2010. Hotel is a gorgeous and modern hotel. Yes you definitely need a car one day we walked back from Brentwood and it was a bit precarious although there were major roadworks taking place. The hotel willingly drive you to local places ie Brentwood which was a really big help because we were without a car for a day. Front desk staff are great and are extremely helpful. Restaurant is good although a little pricey. Our room was gorgeous with so much space. We had a big enough fridge in the room to put in our own snacks we had bought each day. The walls are thin and yes we could hear a child crying a 1 point but it really wasn't as bad as I was expecting and didn't disturb us. Our room was opposite the swimming pool although we couldn't see the swimming pool because of the hedges! However, we were hardly in the room in the day! Loved the fact the swimming pool was warm - BIG PLUS! I admit I can be a bit of a snob at times and my husband regularly says I have OCD! Nevertheless this would not stop me from staying here again! If there is one thing the hotel falls down on its charging for valet service EVERY day. Because of the location of the hotel, you need a car and it is a bit mean not to offer free parking or some sort of deal for those staying over 2days. However, having already read the comments on this website we were prepared for it. Its about $25 a day. A bit steep, but we didn't let it spoil our stay. We enjoyed staying out of the 'hubbub' of Hollywood and being able to have breakfast every day in Brentwood - people watching! Loved it! Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Bear025
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at the Luxe on sunset on our recent holiday and i can not relate to many of the negative reviews on this website. The hotel rooms are very comfortable with large beds, bouncy carpets, decorated well and large balconies. we were lucky enough to overlook the pool which is generally quite quiet with sun loungers free all the time we stayed there. The restaurant serves amazing food and the staff can not do enough to help you! I was very sad to leave and can not wait to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “iT IS A NICE AND VERY WELL LOCATED HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: OctaviO_10
Reviews.Content: It is a charming and cozy Hotel.Very good location,close to the Getting Museum and to the UCLA campus.A little noisy early in the morning.Breakfast is included!Good deal:after 3 days,the 4 is free!A big and confortable room!

Reviews.Title: “Tired and run-down, saved by friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mrkz
Reviews.Content: If it weren't for the friendliness of the front desk staff I would have knocked another star off this -- but they are lovely and full of enthusiasm. Frankly, they are the only thing this place has going for it. The hotel itself is dire except for the common areas. Feels like a half hearted renovation of an old family motel, with pretensions to luxury it just doesn't deliver. The walls are thin, connecting doors between rooms means noise travels, and there are not enough power outlets. The brown on brown decor only accentuates the long corridors and low ceilings. In my room, the "stylish" wallpaper was beginning to peel, and the "designer" books wrapped in white paper were tatty and dirty. As other have noted it is isolated from everything except the Getty and UCLA -- you are tucked on the edge of some quiet residential areas. The building itself is divided into two parts separated by a very steep hill -- you are either at the lower pavilion with restaurant and bar, or the top with pool. Either way it is a loooooong steep walk up, or else a wait for a shuttle to drive you. For the prices they charge, you can do much much better in a more friendly area. A previous review said this was lipstick on a pig -- very true, and I wish I had read that before I spend money here.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Ruined My Wedding!!”
Reviews.Author: jlove02
Reviews.Content: My family and bridesmaids and I stayed here the night before my wedding. After seeing the lobby decor, I had high hopes. It all looked very promising. Two of the rooms were decent.
