However, the last room was smaller and had a handicap bathroom which was ok but we were never informed of it nor did we request it. And now on to the problems (and there were many of them). Our rooms, which were located up the hill, were the first 3 rooms by the second valet booth. Guest was constantly going in and out. Normally this wouldn't be a problem BUT the walls are SOOOOO thin that you can hear EVERYTHING. No sound barrier whatsoever. While in my room, I could hear everything my neighbors to the right of us were doing. I mean everything, from them going in and out of their room, to what temperature they wanted the thermostat at, to what drink they were going to make and lastly, to their intimate night together. Needless to say, I did not get any sleep the night before the most important day of my life. As a bride, I was expecting to get a full nights rest so I could be alert and ready for my wedding. Mind you, I don't have problems sleeping. I can sleep through some noise but this was ridiculous. And when one of my bridesmaids went to complain, they tried arguing with her and making up excuses. What kind of customer service is that?! Unfortunately, the groom and I planned to stay there the night of our wedding as well. While the room was better, we could still here kids running up and down the halls early in the morning, as if there were no walls separately us. On top of this, my MOH and bridemaids had ordered room service (cheeseburger and salad) and champagne glasses and a bucket of ice to be delivered for us both of which NEVER arrived. And this was after my MOH had reminded them 3 times to bring us these items. The Luxe's management team is a complete joke. They are incompetent and arrogant and brought me unnecessary stress. I WILL NEVER STAY AT THIS HOTEL AGAIN NOR WOULD I RECOMMEND IT TO ANYBODY!!

Reviews.Title: “If you like staying up ALL night, then stay at Luxe”
Reviews.Author: MrJoeNYC
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel. First of all, my room was was up a steep hill with no way to get there unless I drove up in my car or by walking. Wonder what happens when it rains? I had a room next to very rowdy people, who were partying all night. I called the front desk several times to no avail, it was only when I told them I was contacting the police that action was taken. If you're a well-heeled traveler on business or searching for some R&R, don't even think of staying at the Luxe. It will be worst then your worst nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonPhilC
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Luxe at the end of a two week fly drive down the West Coast of the USA, we could not have been more impressed. Every member of staff was courteous and helpful and went out of their way to make us feel welcome, none more so than Debbie, the concierge, who was full of helpful ideas on what we might do during our stay . Our room (two queen beds) was large and very well-equipped, and during our stay we made full use of the pool area, which was never too busy and also the gym, which while pretty basic met all of our holiday needs. On our last night we also enjoyed a very good meal in the hotel restaurant, again with excellent service. True the valet parking charge of $24 per day is a bit of a pain, but that service was provided with such efficiency and courtesy that that's really only a minor gripe far outweighed by all the other positives. Located just off the I-405 in Bel Air/Brentwood, the Luxe provided an excellent base for exploring Santa Monica, Malibu and the rest of the greater LA area. It could not come with a higher recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay, great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Ina010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Luxe in July with our two teenagers. I asked for, and got, a room in the upper building. Great, spacious room, as far as I remember room 329. Ground level with a small patio with two chairs, and easy access to the pool. The pool area is really nice! Great location, very friendly staff, excellent service! Thank you, we had a great stay at the Luxe. Tone

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things that bring Luxe down just a notch”
Reviews.Author: CouncilmanK
Reviews.Content: The Luxe is in a great location if you are sightseeing around LA - just minutes from Beverly Hills, the Getty museum and villa, Santa Monica, and right off the 405. The hotel is a result of a definite renovation - and perhaps that was the cause of some of the annoyances that knocked the hotel down from very good status for me. There were few outlets in the room, no alarm clock/IPOD station, a pool, yet no hot tub for some very mild LA weather, and the TV remotes were notoriously unresponsive. The fitness center only contains one treadmill - and there are no easy paths to exercise on nearby - something that should be improved upon (and the fitness center expanded). However, the location and value of the hotel (if you get a deal) can make this a positive experience for those looking to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel run by children”
Reviews.Author: slmd7
Reviews.Content: I have been waiting six weeks for a refund of close to $100 because of a billing error of the staff at Luxe Sunset Boulevard. I have been dealing with a guy named Israel Hernandez who keeps writing that my AMEX credit will show up soon. I am at my wit's end. Do NOT stay here. There is no one in charge.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Arabiandweller
Reviews.Content: The Luxe has outstanding service!! Every staff member I encountered was extremely friendly and accommodating. They even provide a free shuttle anytime you need to go somewhere within a 3 mile radius of the hotel (which is very helpful since the location is a bit isolated, unless you want to visit the Getty), and they are willing to wait for you if you have to shop for something. There is also free wireless, which is a major bonus when travelling, and an iron and ironing board in the room. The downsides, however, are the rooms are dark with depressing decor and are not as clean as they should be. It just seems as though the staff doesn't take the time or care enough to insure the room is spotless for the next guest. It's almost clean, but just not quite. One reviewer described it as 'lipstick on a pig' - this is exactly what it is. The bed is very clean, but my bathroom had sticky stuff on the floor and stained towels, and you just felt like it wasn't thoroughly cleaned, which to me is the most important thing about a hotel. The meal I had at their restaurant was also one of the worst I ever had in my life. If you enjoy quality food even just a little bit, do not go to this restaurant. After the horrendous dinner I had, I didn't bothered with their breakfasts. I hate to be negative about a hotel, but I feel it's important to get an honest opinion out there for anyone who cares about cleanliness and quality food. If those two things don't matter as much, then the Luxe is otherwise an excellent hotel!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME as always!”
Reviews.Author: seaajfc
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the luxe for several years, whenever we travel to LA [about 3-5 times/year]. The service is always to the level of a Ritz and the rooms are larger than suites at most luxury hotels. Easy and conveinient access to the 405, less than 2 blocks; quarter mile from the beautiflu shops and restuarants of Brentwood Village as well. The ONLY hotel in LA that I would rate above the Luxe would be the Montage Rodeo Drive!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: chayesTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luxe in May and it was fabulous. The staff was amazing and very professional. As a travel consultant, I will always recommend this property to any of my clients needing a place to stay in the area.

Reviews.Title: “LUXE: The name says it all.”
Reviews.Author: Tamara_Wyatt
Reviews.Content: This May was my second stay at Luxe Hotel Sunset and it was even better than the first. This hotel is like a fortress. It's located right off of the 405 fwy and near UCLA's campus. It's not too far from anything you may want to get to. It's quiet, peaceful and simply gorgeous. The staff is incredible as well, even a year later they remembered me, by name, and treated me with such kindness and hospitality. The pool area was flawless and we were able to get whatever we wanted poolside including massages, brunch, and drinks. I was on a girls trip, but this is somewhere I would definitely bring a significant other because it does have a very romantic feel as well. When I'm in LA, I fully intend to continue to book my accommodations at Luxe on Sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Luxe on Sunset Boulevard Bel Air Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: viczic
Reviews.Content: Great location, even though on Sunset Blvd and near the 405 Freeway, its surrounded by lush vegetation & gardens so you cannot hear any noise whatsoever. I had a fantastic room with a large king bed, clean spacious and exceptional for the price! Wouldnt recommend the food at the restaurant or room service for that matter - theres a nice little cul de sac community on Barrington St about a 5min drive west off Sunset Blvd that has some nice cafes and restaurants - only locals would know about. The guy at checkin was most helpful - the spa is great, pool facilities are fab and the location to Bel Air, Santa Monica is close by. Its also situated very close to the Getty Centre which is a must see in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Lipstick on a pig”
Reviews.Author: europa00
Reviews.Content: Arrived at hotel after dark - entrance alley was extremely dark, wasn't exactly clear where to go. I think some exterior lighting would be nice. Very hard to pull out of this alley onto Sunset if you are making a left, I really think the car (well, Escalade) that almost hit me sped up to try make a point. Hotel common areas are very nice and well designed, but this hotel just feels like an upgraded average hotel. Rooms were odd - big rooms, small TV for a room this size; tv remote not very responsive; desk didn't have any power outlets, bathroom shower was nice, but an old small tub, toilet stopped flushing the morning I checked out. Room had two beds, each bed had lots of fashion pillows, but then only one regular pillow. Room was "connecting" to next door, had the fun of hearing unruly children in the evening and the morning. Just overpriced, average hotel with lots of lipstick.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel if you can stay in Santa Monica”
Reviews.Author: sbrita
Reviews.Content: Had the pleasure of staying at the Luxe recently. Staff was great and courteous. When checking in, there were suites available and they quickly upgraded me without a question. The suite was wonderful - big (probably 1,000 square feet) and the bathroom was outstanding - marble stone all the way through and separate shower and tub. Room was definitely A+. Hotel itself is pretty hip and may not be so great for kids - but I did hear a family next store so I could be wrong. I didn't get to check out the pool and fitness but heard it was very nice. I ordered room service and it actually got delivered in 15 minutes rather than the 45 and normal hotels. Would definitely recommend staying here if you are in Santa Monica. Only drawback - there isn't anything in walking distance from the hotel. You want something to eat or a cup of coffee and don't want to stay at the hotel - you'll need your car. Its a short drive either direction on Sunset to find something but you can't walk.

Reviews.Title: “Trying to be more...”
Reviews.Author: Memon1811
Reviews.Content: From the onlook the hotel looked very nice, but the poorly staffed front desk, the thin walls, and the smaller details, like no water at the gym, made this hotel less than what it's trying to be, a posh high end hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The staff here deserves recognition”
Reviews.Author: sandiegonat
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Luxe this last weekend. I now realize all the previous reviews on here about how NICE the staff there is, is very accurate. So true! The minute you walk in here you are treated so well, the staff here is great. From anyone who you deal with by phone or anyone you simply pass down the hallway, we were always treated well. Our room was HUGE, I didnt expect such a large space. The parkiing situation is unfortunate (having to pay) but i have nothing negative to say about the service here. The location is nice, right off the 405 and with a nice little view of the Getty. We used the spa services and i felt they were a bit over priced but other than that, it was all a great experience.The rooms are decorated in a neat and modern way, i would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother Booking a Room Here”
Reviews.Author: Auddy
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time or your money staying here. I recently stayed there and everything was a DISASTER. Where do I start? 1) When I asked the valet for a ticket, I was told "I gave you one yesterday". I told the guy that was impossible since it was my first time at the hotel. I finally asked the guy if this was a joke and then he said that he had mixed me up with someone else. 2) The acutal check-in/taking of my credit card was quick. However, getting to my room was a nightmare. I was sent to a room where there was a rag and large commercial fan on the floor. I called the front desk and an employee came to the room. She stated "not again, this happened yesterday". She said I couldn't stay in the room because the carpet was wet. It took 20 minutes back and forth with the front desk to finally get transferred to another room. First, I was told someone was bringing me new keys. Then I was told, to go down and get the keys. Then someone called back and said they were coming up. Each time it was a different person. Talk about a lack of communication. Finally, someone came up with new keys but he was dumb enough to ask "so what's wrong with this room. I opened the door wide open and he said "oh".... 3) Room service is overpriced and BLAND. Also the hotel does not list the room service charges and service charge prices. I travel for business and pleasure frequently and this is the first time I have never seen this information published. The server forgot my receipt. He said that he would be right back. Of course, he never came back. I had to call the front desk in order to get a receipt for my expenses. 4) My blow dryer was broken! 5) I went downstairs for a conference. They had switched the room location. I asked a guy if he knew where my meeting was being held and said yes and pointed me in the WRONG direction. 6) I explained all of the issues with my stay with the director of guest services. I was so frustrated that I thought someone should know. He comp'd my room charge which wasn't my intent since I was traveling on business. I simply wanted someone to know all the headaches that I had to deal with during my stay. He also granted me late checkout. Interestingly enough, he didn't communicate this to anyone or put notes in the system. First, the front desk called me and asked when I was planning to checkout of my room since no notes were in the system for late checkout. Second, when I checked out of my room, the charges were still on the bill and they had to track the director down. Third, the director kept apologizing and promised that he would send me an email detailing our conversation and providing me with his contact information in case I need anything in the future. It's been five days and no email. I'm sure though that the General Manager will see my review on tripadvsior and all of a sudden want to comment on my stay... Granted the rooms are spacious but this place is not worth the headache or the price. Internet connection is awful. The spa and gym aren't even located in the same building. They take you there in a golf cart and the gym closes at 10 p.m. Food is bland. Take my advice and stay away! There are so many places to stay in LA, don't waste your money here. I left with a headache!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay - Nice Staff”
Reviews.Author: zsuzu
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the delay in posting. Starting with the basics: our room was clean, the beds comfy and the room service quick and efficient. Location, if you are okay with highway driving, is excellent for getting around the westside of LA and the hotel is away from the hussle and bussle. No sign of highway noise in the room. Decor is very nice and the staff were helpful and pleasant. The hotel's website gives an accurate impression of the hotel. It's a low rise hotel that has been completely and impressively refurbished. Two cautions. One, if you are noise sensitive request a non-adjoining room. Our room had a connecting door to the room next door and I swear we could hear literally everything going on next door. We found our neighbours amusing though so it wasn't a problem but I could see this being a massive irritant with either different neighbours or if you hate noise. Two, be aware that there is a $24/night parking charge and it's valet parking so factor in a tip as well.

Reviews.Title: “Could be great but isn't.”
Reviews.Author: Drifter123
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff from the moment you drive up. The food was very good as well. The problem with this motel conversion is the room. Ours was spacious but just not quite what you would expect. The TV was too small. No phone at the desk. The internet was painfully slow as I tried to get some work done. The shower was like taking one in an RV. The biggest problem was the paper thin walls. The woman next door was having some serious work done and she was loving it. After a while the amusement wears off as you need to get some sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Queen of Customer Service - Katrina Butts!”
Reviews.Author: sailingzen
Reviews.Content: We did not want to be stuck in LA, but missed connections, broken planes and lost luggage forced us to visit the Luxe Hotel on Sunset, and it was Rose Bowl Weekend to boot! After checking into the sold-out property, we entered our large king room and used the free wi-fi to check our rates. They seemed high, so I emailed the manager of the hotel. Quickly, Katrina, the Reservations Director, responded. She explained the "sold out" rate clearly and discounted our next night, significantly. After learning of our travel woes, she sent special treats to our room, offered coupons and happily let us stay in our room for a late check out before returning to LAX. We were quite comfortable, even without our luggage, toiletries, etc. Thank you, Katrina, for making a travel headache into a restful stay enroute to New Zealand.

Reviews.Title: “A good, if not perfect, choice”
Reviews.Author: ZurichKashew
Reviews.Content: The location is good, the size not too large and not too small, the service was friendly and efficient ... all in all a fine choice. The beds were also nice and there was FREE internet access near the front desk. There are two drawbacks. First, one is dependent on a car (who doesn't have a car when in LA?). Second, due to the age of the hotel, the rooms are not always perfectly quiet (was built in the 60's?). Also, if one is unlucky, there will also be background traffic noise in some of the rooms. We stayed twice for 5 and 2 nights respectively. During the first 5 nights, we had one night with elephant step neighbors above us (can people really walk SO heavily uninterupted for HOURS?) and a pacing telefoner on the patio next door who was obviously hard of hearing and didn't care whether we knew all his business details. Having said that, the other nights were quiet and we slept like babies in the very comfortable bed. During our second stay, we requested a move from the freeway to the pool side and were lucky that there was a vacant room available. The junior suite was spacious. Very nice parking valet service ... 24/7. Also a free shuttle available to the Getty. There is a fitness room where everything works. There is also a spa, which we did not use. It seems in LA you have the choice between the cheapies which are often on busy streets or the 5 star hotels. If you need something in between, the Luxe would suit - adequate 4 star range. Also, for being on the westside of town, it is ideally located. We booked an attractive package, which included parking and continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nasty Food, Receptionist gave us a room key to a room ALREADY TAKEN!”
Reviews.Author: nswanlove
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at a Luxe hotel again. I was given a room key to a room already taken and walked in on a COUPLE!! When I returned to the desk to get another key, I was given a key for a room at the end of some hall where all the other rooms were open and being renovated. The food was absolutely disgusting - think American Airlines. They humiliated me by asking to charge my room 3 times despite that it had been booked over the phone previously. They charged the wrong credit card as well... mistakes mistakes mistakes and not apologetic in the SLIGHTEST.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: sulvn22
Reviews.Content: Even though there were alot of layers to this hotel it was so comfortable the whole stay. Everyone treated wtih such respect. Excellent service. We were in L.A. for a daughter's surgery at UCLA. It was always very welcoming to come back from the hospital. Great little restaurant. I can't say enough good regarding my stay. I would definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem”
Reviews.Author: dwtn
Reviews.Content: Had a very nice stay. Needed to be close to Westwood and the location was perfect. Very large room, excellent furnishings, nice service down to the valets. Note there are two separated parts of the Luxe, an upper portion (where I stayed) where the pool is located, and the lower part that is connected to main lobby, bar, restaurant, etc. I would suggest asking for a location (upper or lower) that will ensure quiet (not directly over pool or where the hotel holds events).

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious, High Standard, A++, Chauffeurs, Pool, etc.”
Reviews.Author: CiaraMc
Reviews.Content: Victoria & David Beckahm stayed there before. Luxurious, High Standard, A++, Chauffeurs, Pool, with many extras.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too hard to sleep there”
Reviews.Author: dol1234
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luxe for two nights recently. There are lots of good things to say about this hotel. When we first arrived, we were told that we'd been upgraded from a King to a "junior executive suite" -- which isn't really a suite (no extra additional room) but just has an extra alcove with a sitting area. At any rate, the room was huge and very tastefully decorated. We also got free parking & free breakfast passes for each day we were there. Although the breakfast passes said they were only good for the continental breakfast (which was gross), the second day we were told that we could actually just use the passes as a credit towards other stuff on the menu. So the second day we had a much better breakfast and it was free -- yay! At first blush, we were feeling pretty good about the place. We found all the people working there to be very friendly and helpful. No complaints whatsoever. Fast forward to the evening. First of all, the mattress is SUPER firm. So every time my husband would move, even the teeniest bit, the whole bed would shake. That would have woken me up numerous times, had I been asleep... but the walls are so freaking thin that sleep was not happening for us. (our daughter was trying to sleep on the rollaway bed they brought in). The people next door played their TV for what seemed like all night. I don't think they even had the volume on all that loud, but it kept us up. And of course the idiotic drunken revellers stumbling down the hall at god knows what time ... very loud, too. One other thing to note is that if you are staying in the upper building, where the pool, spa, etc. are -- there is no walkway or stairs between the upper building and the lower building (where the restaurant is). You have to walk down a steep street that has about a foot-wide "pedestrian lane" but it's a blind curve and there are crazy cab drivers careening around the corner. We didn't feel safe walking this path with our six-year-old, so we had to rely on the shuttle which was kind of annoying since it's actually not all that far; it seemed to silly to have to get a ride to and from the main building but that was the only safe way to do it. It's a pity, really, because if not for the insanely thin walls, this would be a great place to stay. Unfortunately I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 27stars
Reviews.Content: We booked a summer deal (free upgrade, valet, breakfast) and enjoyed our stay. We checked in around 4, got directions on how to roam around town from the friendly & helpful valet, and when we came back at 8 to get ready for dinner, we found our room received the turn down service with chocolates waiting on our pillow. (nice, thoughtful touch) Room was huge: huge, comfy bed, huge bathroom, huge sitting area with We also received a personalized letter good for 2 free wines/cappuccinos. (the cappuccino comes in a huge mug that I thoroughly enjoyed) The valet & front desk were always friendly, courteous, & helpful. Had lots of fun swimming and relaxing by the pool & grabbing the regular snacks that are out everywhere (green apples & power bars!!) Would definitely come back & stay again! Thanks, Luxe Hotel Staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: EL_Oslo
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at the Luxe Hotel Sunset Boulevard through Tablet Hotels, and got a spacious room which was clean and comfortable. Beds were superb, and the Luxe Hotel also includes a turn-down service. The walls between the rooms could have been better isolated, since I woke up early by the german guy next door arguing with his wife on the phone :-). Pool area was nice, so was the food and drinks at the bar and the restaurant. The service at the restaurant was pretty variable, from excellent to really slow and poor. Apparently they had a lot of beginners serving. Front desk and concierge service was great, they booked us tables at restaurants weÂ´d been recommended. The interior is stylish / design, really cool after our preferences, and the location is great for exploring Santa Monica / Hollywood / Melrose etc. Great value 4-star hotel, summed up.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: prettyrickytexas
Reviews.Content: When checking out, the front desk had a charge on my bill that I did not make. The problem was resolved expediantly and I did'nt get stuck with paying someone else's bill...

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Must!”
Reviews.Author: Irishlane
Reviews.Content: I loved the Luxe hotel plain and simple! I stayed at Luxe for one week and the staff was over the top friendly and willing to help. The atmosphere is airy, yet modern - almost with an earthy Asian influence. There is the Sunset restaurant which has indoor and outdoor seating with on-the-wall waterfall, adding to the nice ambience. The indoor bar area is welcoming, with live music (not every night). The rooms were big and modern with a muted color palate. A nice surprise was the turn down service with chocolates, and if you want to get anywhere with in 10 miles, Luxe valet will take you there. I used it to get to Brentwood Mart and The Getty. I stayed in the main hotel, there is another building above where the pool and spa are located. I liked being in the main hotel, room was quiet (ask to over look garden area) but convenient to restaurant and outdoor seating areas. This hotel is located of the 405, so it is convenient to highways and yet, you feel very secluded - for the price, it is amazing; I felt like I belonged to a private club. A bonus was that during my lunch one day, Tom Hanks and RIta Wilson came into to eat with their two boys! Everyone left them alone, which was cool - they were treated just like the rest of us :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, convenient hotel to Brentwood”
Reviews.Author: tarheeljd
Reviews.Content: Great location if you need to be near Brentwood / Bel-Air. Only recommendation would be to install curved shower rods in bathtubs / showers.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, decent location, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: mmirsky
Reviews.Content: The hotel is divided into 2 buildings - one connected to the lobby and another that is a 5 minute walk up a hill. We were up on the hill in an executive junior suite. Very modern room, with a cool looking bed with posts and frame. Huge bathroom with marble tub and glass stand up shower. We were also right by the heated outdoor pool. Small exercise room with only 1 treadmill next to the spa. Parking was $25-30/night. Room cost $259/night.

Reviews.Title: “An empty heartless room with style”
Reviews.Author: geoman75
Reviews.Content: There is no denying this is a good hotel. Good quality modern furnishings throughout the hotel and in the room. The property is well spaced out with a nice looking outdoor pool and gardens. Our room had the shower in the bath. I think that this level of hotel should always have a walk in shower in this day and age - but may be that is just me. However it is space that makes the rooms feel strange. The rooms are almost too big for their own good. There isn't enough furniture in them so as they feel empty like the hotel has gone on the cheap in not fitting the rooms out properly. The other huge problem with this hotel is the ridiculous valet parking situation. The valet is compulsory but the car park is right there. You literally park the car yourself, then hand the keys and the cash over. Collecting the car seems even more ridiculous as you stand and wait for the valet to move your car literally five meters. I'm also not sure this is the best location in LA either. I suppose it depends what you are doing but it doesn't seem to be near anywhere. Its stuck halfway between Santa Monica and Hollywood. On the way to everywhere but close to nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Luxe”
Reviews.Author: gutman
Reviews.Content: We just competed a 5 night stay at the Luxe Hotel while on vacation in LA for our anniversary. I would highly recommend this hotel if you're looking for a nice place that's a good value with a convenient location. We were able to get a $149 rate from Hotels.com which made it even better. There is a $24 per day valet parking charge, but that's disclosed and not out of line for the area. The concerierge was great (thanks Debbie!) and went out of her way to make our trip more memorable. The rest of the staff was very courteous and helptful as well. The hotel is centrally located and a short drive to the beaches, Hollywood, Westwood, etc. Downtown Brentwood with shops and restaurants is only around 1.5 miles and can be walked if you're a little adventuresome and don't mind crossing Sunset to get to the sidewalk. The hotel is just off the 405 and Sunset, so access to the expressways is good. The hardest part is making a left onto Sunset against traffice from the 405. The pool area is well kept and the water is heated. The hotel also has a tennis court and provides complimentary rackets and balls if you need them. There is a bar and restaurant on site as well. This is a nice location for business or vacation travelers. Both families and those looking for somewhat of a boutique hotel experience should be satisfied. We will definately consider returning the Luxe Hotel the next time we are in LA.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: InesC
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the first part of our holiday. After our long flight from London it was easy to find and met all our expectations. Clean, modern and spacious. We had a executive junior suite with two beds. The bathroom was massive, with two sinks, a large bath and a huge shower! The room had a sofa corner and was big enough for the four of us. We didnt eat at the hotel, we usually drove to the Hollywood ihop for breakfast and in the evening went out. The restaurant was not really suitable for young children. Parking is valet only at $24 + tax a night - but this is typical of almost all hotels in LA. The location was fab as you are already on sunset blvd so its a short drive past Bel Air to Hollywood etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great choice if you want convenience and location”
Reviews.Author: BlueOcean1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the ned of two week trip to California. It is located at the Brentwood end of Sunset, a beautiful and expensive part of LA in the heart of Bel Air / Beverley Hills. The hotel provides the style and luxury you would expect for the area, but at the expense of convenience and comfort. The main problem is that the hotel is split into two buildings accessed by a walk up or down a steep hill. Not inacessible, but unnecessary and inconvenient. The pool is on the upper tier, the reception and bar / restaurant on the lower. The rooms are spacious and have balconies but these are not good for sunbathing as they look on to thick foliage (trees etc). and are mainly in the shade. The pool area is excellent though. Another drawback is the infamous LA valet parking - $27 a night after tax etc. and compulsory. Once the velet guys get to know you're not one of the many business visitors using it as a conference hotel, they seem reluctant to get your car! And believe me you'll need the car - there is nowhere to walk to within twenty minutes of this hotel, and the recpetion staff advise you not to walk in any case (road safety rather than any crime in the area). All of these bad points are a shame because the style and size of the rooms is excellent, but if you're in LA on holiday, you will want something closer to the action and more convenient to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Unfair Marketing Obligatory Valet Parking $24 day”
Reviews.Author: navadim
Reviews.Content: The unexpected obligatory fee should be included in the hotel price. Housekeeping responded only after three phone calls. One small piece of chocolate for two people is typical to this hotel's management. Over priced , over rated and greedy.

Reviews.Title: “Best option in LA”
Reviews.Author: holertingrid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectelly located on Sunset Blvd and the 405. It takes 15 minutes to reach Hollywood, Beverly Hills and Rodeo Drive. It is really clean with detail, it has a beautiful restaurant, heated pool and spa. The most amazing thing is the cordiallity and respect with what the employees treat us. I am from Miami and I travelled around the world and let me say: "What is wrong with us???" I've never experienced such a good customer service like in California and The Luxe Hotel was one of the best hotels in the whole world. They really care about the guests. This is the best option in L.A. You won't be dissapointed. From the Valet, Housekeeping, restaurant employees and the Front Desk (Brian is a DIAMOND). This will be my only choice if I'd go back to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms and very quiet”
Reviews.Author: latiffe
Reviews.Content: Must have rental car to stay at this hotel. There is nothing around it, it is like a hotel on the highway. Parking is vallet and very quick. If you smoke, take the rooms on the ground floor, you have your own patio to smoke. Large rooms, good bed, but small and real simple bathroom. Breakfast is included, but it is so bad you would better miss it. For over $200 per room considering you are in LA this hotel is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great price/value ratio”
Reviews.Author: elynchking
Reviews.Content: I had to be in LA for 1 night for a business event and selected the Luxe because of the price and I was looking for a something more interesting than a big chain. I booked through tablethotels.com and got an excellent rate of $159.00. My first impressions of the staff (valet and front desk) were less than impressive but the hotel itself is a great value. The lobby is very attractive as is the bar area. The place was hopping as there was at least one wedding going on. The rooms are large and attractive. Beds are not the superluxurious pillow tops that we come to expect but, nonetheless, extremely comfortable. Linens are 100% cotton nice quality although I couldn't figure out which were the sleeping pillows vs decorations... The showers are open and I ended up flooding my whole bathroom so ask for extra towels. The biggest downside to this hotel is that the walls are like paper. Fortunately, I travel with earplugs so I had a great night's sleep. My colleague in a room across the hall was not so lucky. In the morning I could clearly hear the conversation of the couple next to me. Also be aware - if you are on the ground floor with sliding doors guests tend to just walk by your room and peer in (rude!) so remember to close the curtains before changing. The hotel is directly off the 405 so very easy to get everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveler Review - Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Travels2Light
Reviews.Content: First, I chose this hotel mainly for its proximity to my meetings, but also because I like somewhat trendy boutique hotels with minimalist furnishings and a cleaner feel. I called the hotel to book directly and they gave me the same low rate that was on Orbitz. Reservation staff confirmed my rate by email. I got the early check in I requested (King Deluxe room) and it was spacious and looked just like their photos advertise. Things I'm quite impressed/happy with: The room is nice and clean, it is not noisy and climate control works. The staff are superb... Miriam at housekeeping (yes I wrote down her name, she was that good) knew exactly what I was talking about when I called and said "the battery in my safe has died" and I got speedy battery replacement that AM and again in the PM when the new battery seemed not to be working so well. Someone came and picked up my laundry just minutes after I called, and delivered my clean clothes on time the same day. I travel a lot for work, and housekeeping and laundry staff are very important! Front desk staff are friendly and helpful in sending faxes and printing things. The restaurant and lounge downstairs seem nice but I haven't really used them, nor have I visit the spa. There are spas at 50 meter intervals in most of West LA, I see no particular reason to use Luxe's spa and pay more for what are very basic services - a manicure, for example. Things that might disappoint the business traveler: The business center is a hot, stuffy closet with a few computers in it. You cannot print there, but you must send your docs to reception or take them over on a USB to print. Not too inconvenient, if you are staying in the same building. If you are in the upper part of the hotel, this might be annoying. The one time I emailed docs to the front desk, they printed them and ran them up and slid them under my door! This hotel is valet parking only, at around $27/day. The hotel is not in walking distance of anything, so if you do not feel like driving or cabbing it after a long day at work, your eating options would be the restaurant downstairs or room service. Both have nice menus, but I haven't tried the food. Oh and ladies, don't come here thinking you don't need to bring bath products. Whatever is in the body wash and shampoo bottles is very generic stuff, not what you'd expect of a property in this price range! Overall, a very good experience, nice rooms, clean, and best of all, excellent service and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Better value than most hotels in LA”
Reviews.Author: FromParisToLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Luxe hotel for 3 nights at the end of January 2009 after some business elsewhere in LA. We booked the "romantic" package which gets you a delux room / suite and includes strawberries and champagne upon arrival, continental breakfast every day for 2 and a free movie. The hotel adds to that a voucher for 10% off the restaurant on one occassion as well as another voucher for a couple of coffee's or glasses of wine at the bar. We *thoroughly* enjoyed our stay here. The hotel staff are very professional and polite, in keeping with this hotel's status as an upmarket destination. Being less well known than many of the larger and more obvious hotels, this is a discreet hideaway and it's not unusual to see some celeb enjoying a quiet drink at the bar. Our room was well appointed and spacious, the bed very comfortable and the view outstanding. Staff were very keen to ensure that we were happy with our room and settled in. We took breakfast every day at the hotel although I would recommend not paying for the continental in advance. The breakfast menu is wonderful and it was too tempting to add side orders to our standard continental. We also ate several times at the bar and restaurant and the food is of a high standard, we especially enjoyed the Dine LA special menu with duck. The outdoor pool was very well heated and since temperatures reached 80Â°F during our stay we profited from it and spent several hours lounging around in pure bliss. Remember that this was in January! The hotel is split into two levels, we were in the upper part. The hill is steep, like some people have already pointed out, but if you can't walk for 2 minutes then you can use the hotel transport, so it's not an issue. We will go back to this hotel, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels we've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: majsis83
Reviews.Content: We were recommended to stay at this hotel by a relative this summer. We are from Sweden and made a road trip and were about to spend the last couple of days of our trip here. We stayed at the hotel for five nights and we had some splendid days. Although we weren't at the hotel so often, we had an awesome time when we were there. The fruit and water table by the pool made our sunbathing experience much more luxe! Fantastic! The location was great, easy to find, just by the freeway. We didn't hear anything of the traffick to our room! The room was really modern and stylish! The aircondition was great! We want to give credit to the cleaning personnell who always cleaned our room so nicely!! It was a friendly gesture that they came to the rooms in the afternoon to ask wheather we wanted new towels. Have to recommend this hotel to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary Classic”
Reviews.Author: Oakville-Realtor
Reviews.Content: I had a very enjoyable stay at the Luxe on Sunset. The staff know what they are doing, the rooms are large, the beds are extremely comfortable (never slept as well in a hotel), the pool is just large enough to do laps, the bathroom was pretty much as big as any I've seen in most 5 star hotels, and the decor is comtemporary classic, with earth tones and strong square shapes. The restaurant is good, but not excellent. I tend to judge on the classic caesar salad with chicken. The chicken was over cooked/dry. The service at the spa is very professional, and welcoming. The pool is salt water, which is becoming the norm. The conceirge was able to let me know about a local but competing restaurant for breakfast, which I did enjoy. I also sat in the bar one night for dinner, and the bartender was excellent. There was only on issue, which was the band that I've been told plays Tuesday and Thursday. I could clearly hear them in my room, and I was a distance from them. Luckily they only played until 10:30 PM. They were good, but it was distracting that I could hear them in my room. Also I could hear every word in the hall (they might want to consider sound proof doors). I would not recommend this hotel to light sleepers (this isn't one of my issues.

Reviews.Title: “Luv the Luxe”
Reviews.Author: galvestonboys
Reviews.Content: A sparkling gem of an oasis. The setting and location are perfect. The two hotel buildings are seperated by a hilly incline which is an easy walk or drive up the hill with the sparkling and beautifully appointed pool on the upper level. A few rooms overlook the freeway, but most overlook the pool and gorgeous surroundings. The room was very large, quiet, and extremely well appointed. The decor and furniture are definitely not IKEA, like some of the other reviewers seemed to think. The staff, valets, and waiters treated us superbly-with prices in line with any major US city-valet included at $21/day. The Luxe is far superior to most hotels in this price range anywhere. We arrived before check in and they allowed us to change in the gym and relax at the pool while waiting. Lunch was excellent and can be delivered poolside.

Reviews.Title: “Treated like second class citizen”
Reviews.Author: DesertDweller11
Reviews.Content: I purchased a two night stay at the Luxe through Sky Auction for my wife's birthday. We checked out after the first night. I booked a king size room. When we arrived at the hotel, we were told that no rooms were available at the time we arrive approximately 12 noon. however we were told to come back later and we would be taken care of. We returned about 6 pm and was assigned a room. We entered the large room that was pleasantly decorated. However it had two standard size beds. Both my wife and I have leg problems and it makes in nearly impossible to sleep in a standard size bed. When I called the front desk, I was told that I would be called back in 15 minutes with a resolution. After about 30 minutes I was called to be told there were no other rooms available and there wasn't anything we could do. I called housekeeping to get a few extra pillows to help brace our legs and was told they would be right up. After 30 minutes we called the front desk and their response was that we would be called in 10 minutes with the location of our requested pillows. 30 minutes pasted and no pillows arrived. We called the front desk again and a few minutes later pillows arrived. Unfortunately the pillows had wet pillow cases. My wife took the pillows to the front desk and asked if the clerk would like to sleep with wet pillows. About 20 minutes later new pillows with dry cases arrived about 90 minutes after the first request. The room had one robe in the closet (the robe was shabby with the lining all torn) we asked the representative how delivered the pillow if we could have a second robe and the response was no only suites can have two robes and if we wanted one we would need to call the front desk. The next morning after a very restless night of sleep we checked out. The clerk at the desk hardly acknowledged are presence and never asked why were checking out early or if we had a pleasant stay. I would urge people to avoid the Luxe.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Luxe!”
Reviews.Author: BetterthanJackBauer
Reviews.Content: First of all it has a great location. Right at Sunset you are quickly in BH or Hollywood (if LA traffic allows). We had a wonderful and great stay. The staff was nice and helpful. Our room was large by all means and we got everything we asked for. Even when we considered switching to a (more expensive) room by the pool, they did not hesitate for a second and showed and offered us the rooms without extra charge. I stayed at numerous hotels in LA and the LUXE was one of the best ones I stayed at. You definitely get a very good price/value ratio. I will definitely stay there again. I might also try out the one on Rodeo. For families I recommend to get a room by the pool, all others stay in the main part.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, nice room”
Reviews.Author: mdog75
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding a few months ago and had a really nice stay. Our room was ready when we arrived, the staff was helpful, and our junior suite was quiet and much bigger than expected. The breakfast at the restaurant was good too. Our only complaint was that the ventilation system in the room was pretty bad -you could actually see the heavy dust buildup all around the giant a/c vent. It was the same in our friend's room, and it was pretty gross and unhealthy.

Reviews.Title: “Pig with lipstick”
Reviews.Author: byuby5
Reviews.Content: This place is an outdated dump. Motel 6 with nice landscaping. You think it is going to be nice and it is not. Staff is poorly trained. Management is weak. I am trying to think of something nice to say and I can not think of anything.

Reviews.Title: “The luxe isn't luxury!”
Reviews.Author: traveler2themax38
Reviews.Content: Rooms were okay. Didn't receive wake up call, only found two towels in room, and had to call 4 times to eventually get them. Food service took in total 21 1/2 hours. Amenities were okay, except bowl of ice cream with cookie was $8. Wouldn't stay here again. Also, room looked out over freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag at the Luxe”
Reviews.Author: SteveHouston
Reviews.Content: We recently spent six nights at the Luxe, located off Sunset Blvd. and the 405 Freeway. As we frequently travel with our small dog on business we were pleased at their "open dog" policy and had no complaints about how we were treated. We booked a Junior Suite (a large room with a seating area - no doors in between). The room was comfortable and had an open sliding door to a grassy area outside - perfect for walking the dog and relaxing outdoors. Rooms and grounds appear well maintained. Service was enthusiastic and very polite, but somewhat spotty - our bags took about an hour to arrive from the main lobby. Wireless internet - there is no wired internet - is spotty and cannot totally be relied upon. There are two main problems with the hotel. The first is that it is located up a steep hill right off of Sunset Blvd. This means that joggers and dog-walkers will have a hard time. We drove about a half mile to a less trafficked area for exercise. The second problem is that the hotel is on two separate levels, separated by quite a bit of steep hill. The main lobby and some rooms are located in the lower level. Another set of rooms, including ours, and the spa are located at an upper level. The only connection between levels is walking up and down the hill on a road, waiting for a sporadic hotel shuttle ride or driving up and down and having the valets handle your car. As we had a lot of business to do at the lower level - we were interviewing prospective staff in the hotel bar and restaurant areas - we found this very inconvenient. On the positive side, location is excellent for driving. The hotel is one minute from the 405 freeway and quite near some excellent parks - including the little known but lovely Will Rogers State Park. We would return to this hotel again, if we could make sure we were given a room on the lower level

Reviews.Title: “Had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: Shiraz888
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a weeks break at the Luxe and thought it was v good. Having read the rather mixed reviews here I was a little anxious, however, I was pleasantly surprised by both the hotel and the service. The room was extremely spacious and spotlessly clean. The decor is nice and quite simple and stylish - certainly better than most US hotels I have stayed at in the same price-bracket. The pool area was also very nice. I found that all staff (valets, front-desk staff, housekeeping, room service) were friendly and efficient. I never had to wait long for my car to be brought round and the valets recommended me some great routes to drive in the hills above LA. Housekeeping staff were also very good and my room appeared to be cleaned about 3 times a day. I did not eat at the hotel restaurant, however, I did order room service for breakfast and snacks. I found the food to be of a decent quality, good portions and also reasonably priced. Personally, I thought the location of the hotel was v convenient - particularly with the 405 freeway being so close-by. A few things to note: there is not really anything within walking distance, parking is $22/day, and Freeway noise is faintly audible in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The Luxe is great”
Reviews.Author: Indykim
Reviews.Content: The Luxe on Sunset is a great hotel - the staff is friendly and helpful and the location is excellent. The rooms were large, a little sparsely furnished but the bed was comfortable and the bathroom large. We received a coupon for a complimentary glass of wine our first night which was appreciated. The food, as it is at most hotels was only okay and overpriced. Skip the toast and coffee breakfast for 12 bucks and walk the 10 minutes to Barrington Ave in Brentwood - a lovely walk along Sunset with beautiful houses to look at and have breakfast at one of the 2 bakeries or Starbucks - for a lot less money. The hotel offers a shuttle service, but to a very limited area - Brentwood, which is a very easy walk, the UCLA area and the Getty Center. The Luxe has a sister hotel on Rodeo drive and since most people want to go to that area, it would be nice if the shuttle ran between the hotels, but it does not - and it is only about a mile out of their three mile radius the shuttle travels. Overall, I enjoyed my stay and would gladly stay there again. Kim from Indianapolis

Reviews.Title: “Boogers on the Mirror”
Reviews.Author: drjoannah
Reviews.Content: I went down to LA to spend Christmas with our Daughter and her family. When I moved into my room it was simply disgusting. There were hairs in the bathtub and toilet. Boogers on the vanity mirror, stains on the carpet and the window as filthy. I should have figured out that the hotel was not what it was cut out to be. As I first walked down the dark hallways, the light fixtures were full of dead bugs! I complained and was offered to change rooms. After looking at the alternative, I chose to stay in my current room because I did not want to listen to the freeway noise all night. I asked for a housekeeper to come by. I explained the problems (fortunately I speed some Spanish) and tipped her in advance. After shopping I returned with some spot remover and applied it to the carpets, and most of the spots came out. I also bought a pair of slippers so as to never have to place my bare feet on the carpets. I made the most out of my trip, but I will never be back to the Luxe.

Reviews.Title: “Dreaful Service”
Reviews.Author: petitchablis
Reviews.Content: Wanted to advise other travellers NOT to book this hotel, staff were incompetent and lacked training and it was not just my husband and myself who had problems three other couples were unhappy also. We had to wait an hour before check in after being advised it would be 5 mins, they double booked our room we had a famiy enter the room 5 mins after we had - mini bar not replenished with water after asking them for 3 days straight to do this, no one seemed to understand the concept of bottled water. I could go on and on but would take up too many pages, please do not go there !

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: shatoora80
Reviews.Content: This hotel was pretty nice. We had a little problem in the beginning, having two double beds instead of one king bed, but they moved us by the next morning. The hotel was located about 15 minutes from Sunset Blvd. The pool was located up a steep hill, which was hell to walk up, but was so beautiful. We also visited the spa, which was relaxing. Overall, this hotel was a nice and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “It's the little things that count”
Reviews.Author: Tottiisahottie
Reviews.Content: This is the second time this year I've stayed at The Luxe on Sunset. I agree with the reviewer that called it "the little hotel that could". If they would just take the time to update/improve certain things, this hotel would be great. Pros -Great location, cool vibe, huge rooms and bathrooms. Cons -Valet parking takes too long, no hotel shuttle service anywhere, thin walls, front desk staff needs to be trained on basic hotel knowledge. The concirege never returned my calls and then went home for the evening leaving us to find a restaurant and make a reservation, when I asked for help from the front desk staff they could not name ONE Mexican restaurant in the area! The front desk staff has no knowledge of the hotel's spa. They will make a reservation for you, but not inform you they will charge you 100% if you cancel, we had to talk to the front desk manager to get things fixed. Little things like burned out lights in the room,the wrong room service menu in the welcome folder, forgotten turn down service, dead batteries in the remote controls, tub not draining the entire weekend and the air conditioning shutting off in the middle of the night and not one person knowing how to reset it. (this is a common occurance at the hotel as it happened in June as well) Mind you this all took place in a Executive Juinor Suite. I would stay here again, as I like the interior and location, but it does get to be a pain when you have to call to the front desk every 30 minutes to remind them of something. The front desk manager did reduce my room rate for all the trouble, but if they just got it together this hotel could be Great!

Reviews.Title: “Lukewarm Experience”
Reviews.Author: LovingtheTravelling
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Luxe Hotel Bel Air seemed a good idea as it was close to our destination but was like a roller coaster â€“ 1 moment all seemed well and the next, not. PROS: Great location to freeway, place looks great from the outside, Front Desk staff friendly, Valet friendly with some confusion at times, cost of $22 for parking each day. Didnâ€™t use the pool, restaurant et al due to lack of time to do so, people using the restaurant seemed fine with it. Room was clean, bed comfortable; TV had TV plus movies, and free internet connection in room. CONS: Service inconsistent â€“ 1. told by the Front Desk there was 24 hour Room Service yet late hours Room Service consisted of a few cold items, not as the Menu page read which had hot and cold items and when we questioned this, they said they didnâ€™t know about that and would call us back, but did not, 2. no daily paper offered, e.g. the Los Angeles Times (this IS Los Angeles) and when we asked, no one got back to us with one nor how we could get one, 3. Checkout time offered a full staff of valet parking personnel but only 1 bellman, causing long waits to bring baggage down, 4. Room hallway painted dark colors so looks long and dark, 5. Room 136 Suite - inconvenient electrical switching, small section of carpet wet by bedside, showerhead regular rather than the deluxe expected of a suite, room situated where you could not watch TV from the bed and sofa, Mini-Bar had small liquor bottles scattered on top of the frig, plus it was not stocked well to help somewhat with the Room Service deficiencies.

Reviews.Title: “You get more than you pay for...”
Reviews.Author: ttocsffej
Reviews.Content: I travel to L.A. every couple of months, and have been reluctant to try this hotel due to somewhat mixed , although mostly acceptable reviews. My wife and I were in town last weekend to attend the Genesis concert at the Hollywood Bowl with clients, so I was looking for something close to the Wilshire Park N' Ride for concert purposes, and also near the Getty Center, where we had lunch the next day. The Luxe (and the Angelino next door) fit the bill, but having had a so-so experience at the latter, I decided to give the Luxe a shot. I will say that things started out a little rocky. We had a "car/room package" and I had trouble getting the hotel reservations department to respond to my inquiries for confirmation and pickup of the car. After too much effort on my part, things were finally sorted out the day prior to my arrival. (General Manager-this is the one department that needs to get it's act together!) Arriving on Sunset Boulevard, a tiny sign--easily missed--in front of an equally well-concealed driveway, leads uphill to an pull-through entry court for valet parking. Clearly, this is NOT "The Peninsula," however, they have done a decent job updating an old but spacious facility. Like other reviewers, I do think they could use a bit more "polish on the apple"--this was an "IKEA quality" re-do, not "Roche-Bobois;" although that is clearly the look they are going for. The lobby and entry areas look very promising, with nice decor and lighting. Very chic. But how about replacing the old steel room doors, mouldings, and bathroom fixtures? These have a "patina" of use that draws attention to what hasn't been updated. The long and overly dark hallways to the rooms are trying for a "cool attitude," but really come off as long and overly dark. That is a shame because all of these things consprire to cheapen an otherwise stylish decor. The biggest issue I have with this hotel is in the details; for example: it's nice idea to have HD flat screens mounted on the walls...but there isn't an HD signal coming to them so every channel looks distorted due to the expanded aspect ratio of the flat screens...springing for HD service would solve that. Our room had an ill-fitted front door that would not close tightly, letting in lots of noise from the hallways. Walls, as others have mentioned, are a bit thin but noise from adjacent rooms is not that obtrusive. That being said, all the basic ingredients for success are present: the rooms have lovely new carpeting, nice decor, good bedding, decent baths, and are huge! The grounds and common areas, especially the outdoor seating areas for the lounge and restaurant, are lovely. One would not realize the 405 is 200 feet away unless on the fringes of the property. The valet parking was very responsive and at $22 is well below the rate for most hotels in L.A. (As for those who've quibbled about tipping the valets repeatedly...go stay at a Motel 6, for god's sake!) This is is L.A. get over it. I practically had to stuff money in their hands as it was; they all seemed reluctant to accept a tip. The restaurant is small but well-appointed. We had good service and a leisurely breakfast there, although the kitchen did not seem to know what eggs "over easy" are supposed to look like. Prices are reasonable for Los Angeles. The true highlight here is the staff, which from the front to the back of the house, were absolutely warm, gracious, and helpful. No L.A. attitude here. We arrived a bit early and were offered a complimentary glass of wine while waiting for our room to be checked by the housekeeping supervisor. No less than 3 people called or came by the room to be sure everything was in order. A welcome bag of dried fruit and nuts in the room from the marketing director was a nice touch...it will score her some future business for sure! I really do intend this as a very positive review. For the location, price, and quality, you'd be hard pressed to touch this elsewhere in L.A. Unfortunately, it's easy to nit-pick the Luxe, because SO much is right that you know a little more money and work invested in the facilities would make this place even finer. Sure, it's not a 5 star, but you're treated like a 5 star guest. The low-key, elegant surroundings have such a private, "clubby" feel, that you forget the bargain rates and come to expect everything to actually BE 5 star quality. That's how good it is. In the $200-$350 price range in Los Angeles, the location and overall experience simply cannot be beaten. I can honestly say I got way more than I paid for...I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Luxe”
Reviews.Author: Carolind
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luxe from August 4 through to August 11 and we loved it so much we came back at the end of August for another week. We are Australians travelling through LA. Upon hearing that we were returning to the Luxe all the staff were genuinely thankful and kept thanking us for coming back. The Luxe is a beautiful boutique hotel, very clean and well maintained. We prefer the smaller "no name" hotels and we found this one perfect. The staff are all so helpful and friendly, always say hello to you whether it be the front desk staff to the housekeeping to the valet. As per the previous review we thought $22 parking was enough and didn't tip and we were never treated rudely, the valet were alwasy friendly and we never waited long for the car. Although the room service menu isn't huge the food is nice and reasonably priced. They have a room service menu, and in restaurant menu and a poolside menu - loved getting food and drinks by the pool. The pool area was just really nice and relaxing, never too busy we always got a bed. They refresh the towels several times during the day. The pool is heated so is a nice temperature no matter what time of day and have nice music playing up there (not loud). There is a steep walk to get to the pool from the front of the hotel but they have a golf cart giving rides to and from the pool for those who don't want to walk. They also have a tennis court and provide rackets and balls. Our room was just the basic room and was very big and roomy. The beds were extremely comfortable and had plenty of pillows. The rooms are just decorated really nicely nad browns and beiges and nice pictures of shells. There is a flat screen TV with cable. They also provide free wifi throughout the hotel, as well as having and "business centre" where you can use computers and printers free of charge. The bathroom was very nice and also roomy. The rooms are kept extremely clean and housekeeping came through everyday. Our room on our first stay was located above the valter parking area but never had a problem with noise of cars or people. The hotel is located on Sunset Blvd, on the border of Brentwood which is an extremely upscale neighbourhood (mostly gated streets). The neighbourhood is extremely safe to walk through and we regularly took walks to the local shops (called Brent-Air) for milk and such. One time Jennifer Garner was there while we were getting some dinner! (Also, staying at the hotel was Sopranos and Bad Boys actor Joe Pantoliano). The hotel is located directly off the 405 freeway and although it is very close, we could never hear any traffic noise at all. Being close to the 405 means is it very easy access to where you want to go. The hotel is located about a 10 minute drive to Beverly Hills to the east and about 10 minutes west to Pacific Coast Hwy in Santa Monica. It is in a excellent, safe location and would definately stay here on our next trip to LA (if only we could afford to live in Brentwood we would!). We cannot say enough positive things about the Luxe. On average the hotel was about $200US per night and was well worth the money for the area. To me, safety is extremely important in where I stay and this area cannot be beat. If you find something wrong with this hotel you are the kind of person who will find something wrong with any hotel, no matter the price or star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeHappy
Reviews.Content: We arrived on 6th August and left on the 11th and our stay was well above average. The hotel has two sections and we were on the upper level. No problem with bags or car although it is valet parking and being English paying $22 a day includes, as far as I am concerned, the ability to go & come as I please at no extra cost whatever the Yanks say! Room was lovely, quiet and well fitted out although no lift between floors and we were on the top floor of 2. Staff couldn't be more helpful but housekeeping does need to be checked! Staff very helpful and gave us good directions when needed. WE only had breakfast which was well priced and OK on service. The hotel has been well refurbished and the pool was great. My wife & I would certainly recommend the Luxe to all when on vacation to LA..

Reviews.Title: “Disaster”
Reviews.Author: Paula V
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Luxe, a hotel near our home, due to a plumbing problem at our house. When I arrived, the person at the front desk decided, based on my appearance (I came in late, from work, and in informal clothing) that my husband and I should be relegated to a room on the far level of the hotel. I was told I would be driven up, as I was very tired, but when I went to go get the "shuttle," I was told I would have to drive myself up. (My husband and I arrived separately). On the upper level, there was only valet parking, which was fine, but I should have been told that. Also, the parking level was on the third floor, and my room, on the fourth floor . There was no elevator. (I was not told this either). I had to carry my computer and a heavy bag upstairs myself. I had asked for a room with queen beds, and was told there were not any, which I believe was not true. The next day I left in the early morning and returned in a couple of hours. (I had requested and had been given late check-out). I went to sleep. Twice, hotel employees attempted to enter my room, although there was a Privacy hanger placed on the door. Both times, my room door was opened, but the person could not enter since the door was chained. The staff did not respect the sign and the hotel had failed to advise staff members of the late check-out. After complaining, more than once, the hotel made a partial adjustment on the bill. The hotel is beautiful and new, but we were very disappointed with the poor service and bad treatment on the part of the staff. We hope this was an isolated incident.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, serene and comfy”
Reviews.Author: queensboulevard
Reviews.Content: Sadly, we needed to go to L.A. on a moment's notice to go to a family funeral. Our stay at the Luxe Bel-Air made our trip very relaxing and comforting. We had a king room overlooking the front drive, in the lower building. Furniture and decor was very "West Elm" or "Bo Concept" style. Giant, comfy bed, about a dozen pillows, white-chocolate brown-chrome color scheme, sleek "iPod dock style" alarm clock, flat screen TV. Did not hear street noise. I'm very familiar with LA, and even though I don't like Bev Hills or Bel Air at all, this was a great location - Spitting distance to the freeway. Hotel is right next to UCLA-Westwood and halfway between Beaches and Melrose-WeHo-Farmer's Market-Museum areas. Also, reasonable drive to the Valley. Service was always kind and responsive. Front desk staff was always friendly, if not incredibly knowledgeable about local dining recos. (They all seemed new or not from area.) We always got our car from the valet within 5 minutes. No one had their "hand out". The hotel is on a hill, so one building is up a steep hill. We always found valets to take us up to pool area at upper building via golf cart if we didn't feel like walking it. One afternoon, 7 of my local relatives came over (4 little kids, 3 adults) so the kids could swim and eat lunch, and the hotel staff were very gracious. No one questioned whether the kids were guests, etc. One valet even gave the kids a zig-zag "Disney tram ride" on the golf cart to and from pool. Prompt response to request for extra towels. Service in restaurant was friendly but slow, esp when you have four hungry, wet kids with you who just want chocolate milk, hot dogs, fries and burgers! (Otherwise service for breakfast was very prompt, esp one morning we told them we were in a hurry.) We booked through Expedia, and did not get the breakfast-included plan, so we did not pay "top dollar", but it was still above our usual lodging budget. Plus, they charge you $22-night mandatory valet parking! Yikes, But, considering the circumstances, I do not regret our decision. Our only complaints were the mandatory parking charges, the bathroom needed more towel hooks (a common deficiency in hotels all over, I notice), and a teeny-tiny closet. P.S. Mazel tov to the girl who was having her Bat Mitzvah party there Sunday night! Fun to watch from a distance.

Reviews.Title: “Missing attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: MovieGuyParadise_CA
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Luxe Hotel-Bel Air for my first time. Furnished nicely, though everything seems to be painted olive drab green. I was pleasantly surprised to have been upgraded to a suite, although it was on the 2nd floor over a rather noisy driveway valet area. Lots of doors slamming, loud voices etc. While the room was clean, comfortable and well decorated. Finding things as simple as a light swtich was a chore, the maid had turned down the bed and turned on a number lights none of which worked with a wall switch. Lack of convenient plugs to charge a cell phone or laptop shows the age of the original construction. The attention to detail to such things as no shampoo or lotion in the bathroom, a remote control that was inoperative, all of which can be rectified with a quick phone call to housekeepking but really shouldn't be nescessary at this level of a facility. The bathroom lighting was not well suited for a bathroom difficult to see to shave, and would have been awful for applying make up if I had my wife with me. Nice marble in the shower but a motel 6 shower head that was not high enough for a 6' tall person. They do have excellent wireless internet, which was free (as it should be). Surprised to not find a daily newspaper at my door although they claim to offer it on their website (again attention to detail). Lastly I requested an airport pickup and drop off through the concierge, both which were prompt and courteous (and extra cost), but handled by an outside service and not operated by the hotel, hence the return to the airport was in a town car that smelled like old ashtray.

Reviews.Title: “Nice on the outside, but...”
Reviews.Author: deelite9909
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights at this hotel for a birthday weekend, and I'd give it a B overall. PROS: Courteous staff, comfy beds, beautiful restaurant, airy walkways, fairly nice decor, very close to Getty and fine dining. CONS: Noise, $22/night valet-only parking, broken fixtures in room. This hotel seems like they tried to cover up a formerly "crappy" hotel with some paint, nice IKEA-ish furniture, and accents to make it seem more luxurious than it really is. Several wall outlet covers were falling off, the iPod docking clock/alarm was broken, and the walls were fairly thin. But, the staff was so kind and welcoming, and the location was a good one, that these inconveniences mostly made up for the faults. I doubt I would stay here again for $199/night though...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service and Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: danvers
Reviews.Content: Me and My girlfriend just arrived back home to the east coast last night from our stay here. It was amazing. We tried pushing our flight ahead just to stay longer. From the second you pull up and they open your car door, till you check out and they close your car door, the experience is perfect. We booked a suite, and it turned out to be pretty sweet. The room was equipped with a well stocked mini-bar, baskets of snacks, wines, an i-pod docking station that also recharges your i-pod, a flat screen tv with many new movies to choose from, and a 2 silky robes. Also, we had a nice living area to sit in, along with an enormous bathroom, containing a jacuzzi tub, all glass shower, two sinks, and a phone next to the toilet (which was nice to use while trying to push the flight later). The bed were extremely comfortable, and the ac made little or no noise throughout the night. The only noise, however, came from two rude guests along with there 2 rude children who found it funny to be yelling in the hallway at 12 o'clock am about nonsense. But that's not the hotels fault now is it. The pool area was amazing, which towels rolled up on each sun chair, and the water being crystal clear. We ordered some lunch by the pool, including crab cakes and salads which was perfect. I also ended up ordering a steak burger that came out great. The food arrived to the pool in under 15 minutes. Now our room was room 136, which was four rooms away from the front desk. The pool area, which is surrounded by more rooms, is located about 500 feet away on top of a hill. You can either walk, run it, or they'll be more than happy to shuttle you up in a limo golf cart. I would recommend a room down below in the first building, were we stayed, since everything was right there. Its about 500 feet of the highway, so quick access on and off. Also it's minutes from Beverly Hills and Hollywood. We also enjoyed facials at the "Zen styled" spa up on the hill by the room. They ran $135.00 per facial, which lasted one hour. Honestly, was it worth $135.00 you may ask? No. But I am a guy, and i think women have more of a love for those types of things. My better half booked it. It was relaxing tho. Overall, the stay was amazing, and I plan on returning very soon. I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting to really relax and enjoy themselves, and of course be well taken care of. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Luxe...”
Reviews.Author: AP_Phoenix
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Luxe Hotel for a weekend (feb 16th-18th) and really loved the decor of the room and lobby...modern w/ very clean lines throughout. The room was REALLY spacious (got a room with 2 double beds). Also like the location. Very friendly staff. Some issues: 1) Being on Sunset right off the 405, the room was a bit noisy. If you need silence to sleep this may not be the place for you as you can hear the freeway. 2) Parking costs $22 a day which is not uncommon in LA, however during the day no self parking is permitted...so on top of the charge, I had to tip the valet to park my car. Unable to rate the restaurants or pool / spa as I really only used the room as a crashpad. I might stay at this hotel again... i'd say it was above average except for the noise.

Reviews.Title: “RUN AWAY! ...as fast as you can!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for a hotel with NO service, this is the place for you! There is an overall lack of management at this property. Not enough staff is the biggest fault. The upkeep at this property is non-existent: rooms (and I visiting a few of them) have broken door hardware, outlets, bath fixtures, and non-operating refridges. The grounds around the pool and buildings are not maintained (weeds and small trash are seen in many corners of the exteriors). Good luck getting anyone to bring a few towels up to the pool! The unfortunate logistics of the parking on the property are worsened by the fact that the front desk (10 feet away from the front valet stand) refuse to coordinate with the sub-contracted valet/parking folks. An antiquated phone system doesn't allow you to call them either... that would make sense, and anything that seems logical is absent from this hotel. One again, I blame the G.M. of this hotel... and guess what?... there ISN'T even a manager at this hotel... actually told this by the front desk personnel! Now THAT'S logical, huh? I live in Los Angeles and book my visiting clients in local hotels. I'm glad I never sent any of them here before seeing for myself. PLEASE do not be enticed by the low rates and great deals that can be found for this hotel. And one last dig... the 'spa' was running 1 1/2 hours behind on their appointments for treatments. Ridiculous. I couldn't keep waiting, so I had to cancel my massage reservation due to other plans. Run away!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the hype...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'd read the reviews before staying here, but I had to try the property due to the corporate rate my client had negotiated with Luxe. The hotel staff were very nice on check-in, no complaints there. And the room was large, also nice.
