However... the air conditioning didn't work (except for brief 5 minute periods), the parking was a nightmare, the road noise from 405 was ridiculous, the bed was hard, and the carpets looked vintage (read: not cleaned in the last 50 years). I wouldn't stay here again. Not a fan.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Luxe”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I read mixed reviews on this hotel so was somewhat concerned. Arrived there and hotel staff was very courteous. Had a room by the spa that had a terrific view of LA from the patio. Room was very clean. Went to a wedding that evening and when I returned the coffee was refreshed and the beds were turned down. Very nice. Very close to the 405 and the Getty. Had some time to kill so went on a nice drive down Sunset to Pacific Palisades. Overall was very pleased and don't know what the bad reviewers expected.

Reviews.Title: “An off freeway oasis”
Reviews.Author: pux
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 5 years ago.On reading a couple of unfavourable reviews on Trip advisor we almost stayed elsewhere this time.SO GLAD we didnt.Just off the main 405 freeway-it is like entering a quiet enclave to drive into this hotel.Our room $159 /night plus parking was in the top building over looking lush greenery ,trees and the pool.the rooms are huge with balconies or terrace,ok, v.slightly dated in decor but spotless(and Im a HUGE fusspot!!.) The front desk staff were utterly charming and very helpful and I could not fault them in any way.when we chose to return for the last few nights of our touring holiday before returning to the UK we were upgraded to a massive suite at no extra cost.I can recommend this hotel without reserve and suggest you ask for a room in the top building by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Cool and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: smithdallas
Reviews.Content: Well located right off the 405 at Sunset and easy to get in and out of. Good restaurants just down the street off of Sunset. It was cool in an old LA kind of way. You know you are in LA when you are staying there, and I mean that in a good way. The rooms are large and comfortable. Stay here if you are looking for a nice hotel, pretty good service, in a great spot. Don't stay here if you are looking for 5 star service or want everything brand new.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We got a decent rate on the room ($159/night) because of an event we were attending. We were disappointed with the room and the service. First off, it feels as though they renovated an old apartment building into a hotel. The rooms have seen one too many parties. There were stains in the carpet, the bathroom was old and the layout was a little weird. When we were checking out, there were two check-out attendants. One was flirting with another guest and the other just stood there. It took us almost 30 minutes just to check out. The spa was greatly greatly disappointing! I'm shocked to find out that several major magazines, inlcuding InStyle recommended the spa services. The massage was unimpressive and unpampering. Lastly, there's nothing in the area... inconvienant. We will never stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Gold-plated rip-off”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ordinary accommodations, outrageous rates, padded bill. I seldom have such a bad experience that I'm moved to post, but be warned: unless you're willing to make 10 trips to the front desk to complain (waiting each time for the desk attendant to finish his phone call), you won't get adequate service. â€¢ When I checked in, the main hotel was full so they put me in the "guest house" adjacent. No elevator, no valet parking, and a stale-smelling hotel room that was utterly generic in furnishings and decor. â€¢ Couldn't turn on the air conditioner and phoned for assistance, which never arrived. â€¢ $18 fee to park your own car -- same charge as for valet parking. â€¢ They charged me 9.82 for 2 phone calls: then sent the same charge again on a separate receipt. â€¢ Only source of refreshments is the minibar. I broke down and had a soda with a posted price of 3.50; cost on checkout 7.50. â€¢ Lost my receipt at airport security and spent 2 full weeks phoning the Luxe for a copy. Only got a return call by resorting to threats. â€¢ In brief: this place has an address and a name to offer. Everything else is pure attitude. A dismal disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere & Near UCLA campus”
Reviews.Author: HiddenMeadows
Reviews.Content: Got room through Priceline and were pleasantly surprised. Nice atmosphere. Room was quite small but was nicely appointed. Room felt clean. Parking $18 and mandatory was more than we would prefer to pay. Did not get a chance to check out the grounds but from what we saw and experienced we would return. Near to UCLA campus which was our destination. Look forward to a return visit.

HotelInfo.Name: Luxe Sunset Boulevard Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 11461 Sunset Boulevard, Los Angeles, CA 90049
